Reviews.Title: “Not the largest rooms, but great loaction and superior service!”
Reviews.Author: Sam R
Reviews.Content: For a Wyndham resort I wouldnt say the rooms are quite as impressive as others, but that is easily made up for with the great location and top notch service. Who needs a big room in New York anyway? You'll probably end up only using your room to sleep! Of course, this is the city that never sleeps so you might not need your room at all! Make sure you book this one way ahead of time, its a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: celiaonthefly
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. Very nice rooms, updated and comfortable. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating. One complaint ~ the towels! Not sure why it is that this hotel feels like they can provide small, thin, rough cheap towels. I stay at a variety of different hotels so I don't expect top quality every time, but these were really unacceptable. A very easy fix to achieve a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Mighty”
Reviews.Author: enceey
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend event. This hotel is a little gem..modern, clean and reasonably priced in the heart of Manhattan. It is within walking distance to Madison Square Park, Empire State Building, Flatiron Building, Fifth Avenue shopping and city tour buses. Our room was quite small, but had everything we needed. We could have opted for a larger room, but since we were only there for the weekend we decided not to spend the extra money. It was unfortunate that when we were there the hotel lobby was in the process of updating, but the staff was more than accommodating and pleasant. Exercise room with bikes and treadmills are on premises. San Rocco is a great full service restaurant on the ground floor which offers indoor and outdoor seating. In the Big Apple this hotel had a Small Town feel. We'd stay there again any time. Great value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gigim11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend. I really liked the location...next to Eately, shake shack and was relatively quiet. The lobby, if you even want to call it a lobby, had a weird set-up, was teeny tiny, barely fit a few people and just felt strange. The rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, service was very good but don't expect anything fancy. if your looking for a deal, this is your place but next time I think I will spend a little more to stay at a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Reasonably Priced Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NellGwyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to obtain a hotel room that was reasonably priced and close to one of NYC's major hospitals. As this was a last minute booking, I didn't have much hope of finding something decent and within our price range. The Wyndham came through for us! Although the king sized bed (one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in) dominated the room, the overall effect was very pleasant. The LCD TV on the wall and the digital alarm were two exceptionally nice touches. Clean bathroom with very nice toiletries. Quick check in and out. Overall, we felt as though we had stayed at a far higher priced establishment. A real bargain and would definitely book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: R W
Reviews.Content: I was very fortunate that when I arrived at 9am to check my bags and continue on for the day, there was a room available and I was allowed an early check in. What a great way to start my day! Room very clean, staff friendly. Free wifi-perfect. No issues logging on.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem-Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dixonr925
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I stayed at a Wyndham property and I came away very impressed. From check-in to check-out the staff was particularly attentive and welcoming and the location can't be beat as it's convenient to the subway, Fifth avenue, a 10 minute walk from Penn Station and all the shops and restaurants that Chelsea has to offer. The free wifi was a bonus as many of the hotels in NYC charge for access and the room was spacious compared with some of the other properties that I have stayed at. The Hotel is clean, comfortable, rooms are well appointed with premium beds and bedding. If you want a great hotel with an exceptional staff that wont cost a fortune with a convenient location--consider the Wyndham Garden Hotel, Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: m_hargrove
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 26-12-11 to 31-12-11 central hotel 5 mins walk from times sq n macys free breakfast which is lovely room small but u only sleep here its nyc hotel staff lovely will book trips for u at discount prices. hotel have lots of laptops free to use for guests and free wifi all through the hotel would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic hotel staff..”
Reviews.Author: aalexmik
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the Wyndham on W. 24th while getting our daughter setup at Parson's. The staff there was incredibly helpful and friendly (especially Aaron and Winnie). It is located between 5th and 6th Avenue and is incredibly convenient to a variety of great shops, stores and restaurants, including a Michelin one-starred place right next door. 24th is not a major cross street but we never had to wait more than 3 minutes for a cab plus you could walk to either 5th or 6th, in about 2 minutes time, if you wanted to catch a bus. We stayed on the 11th floor and did not hear any street noise - other guests, staying on lower floors, said the street noise was annoying - see if you can book a room higher up. Also, check with the front desk folks about getting vouchers for breakfast - the restaurant is a separate thing but they do a good job on omlettes and have a good variety of breakfast choices. We'll stay there again, gladly, when visiting Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: Josh T
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Wyndham on 24th St. over MLK weekend. The staff is great, the rooms were spacious considering some rooms I have stayed in within the city when keeping price in mind. Our room came to 111.00USD a night, not that bad. It's a 2 block walk to the subway and a quick shot to popular attractions in Manhattan. The room had a flat screen, comfortable bed, nice size bathroom, desk with phone, alarm clock, closet with iron/board. Ice is located on the first floor, thats the only bad thing but it's not the end of the world =) They also have parking at a garage up the street, I believe the rate was about 48+tax a day. Three days parking came to 154.00USD, again not bad at all in the city. Most parking is 60+ for 24 hrs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit NYC. With it being so close to the subway it doesn't matter if you aren't right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: palmer3dogs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the perfect location. Right around the corner from the Flatiron Building, really more Gramercy Park than Chelsea.The staff was terrific; friendly & helpful with a sense of humor. The front desk even called us on our first night to make sure everything was ok. Then the night before we were to checkout they called to see if we'd need any transfer help. The rooms are typical NYC hotel rooms...tiny. However, our double/double was very pretty, nice linens, good lighting, and cozy. Beds were fabulous! It was also very, very clean. Wifi was complementary. Bathroom amenities were nice. The lobby can get a bit crowded as it's pretty small, but very "european" feeling to the place. We'd absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mflower275
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room was small but the rooms were very cozy and very clean. There was enough lighting (which I usually have a problem with at hotels.) The staff was very pleasant but I would have appreciated if they were able to come to my room when I asked for a complimentary toothbrush (but that was minor.) Although I didnt stay long enough to utilize the gym, it was equipped with equipment that I would actually use. The only problem that I had was the shower stalls werent built properly. The base wall was very short and didnt prevent the water from spraying on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Hair on the beds.. 2 BEDS!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaleigh R
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel would never stay there again. The staff was friendly and very helpful which was nice, was in a good location, but was dirty. When i say dirty i mean i dont think they change there sheets or wash the showers. My fiance and i stayed her overnight for one night and ended up sleeping on the couch and the chair in the living area part of the room (we were in a suite) And the only reason we were in a suite was because they gave us a new room after we found pubic hairs in our first rooms bed in the sheets!!!!!!!!!! Then at 5 a.m they switch our room for us because there was noone available to bring us new sheets and when i asked if i could come down and get them she said they had none.. HUH???!?! Suprise Suprise no clean sheets, well i wasnt so suprised they had no clean ones considering ours were dirty!! When we finally got to the new room we just wanted to hop in bed. So we did and what do we find a stain on the bed and more Hair!!!!!!!!!!!! it was evrywhere so we took the extra sheets in that room that they had for the extra bed and went to put them on and they also had hair on them!!!!! HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE!!!! Every blanket sheet and bed in there had hair on it! Worst experience of my life, my neck still hurts from sleeping on the coach and i deffinetly would not reccomend and suggest if you do stay here to look over the entire bed before hoping into thinking your getting a good nights rest!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Andrea J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location and was the perfect choice for me and my friends for NYE in NYC. The room was beautiful, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at the Wyndham Chelsea West again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsay12360811
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with some friends, the staff was nice, the room was clean, and overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: Hilary W
Reviews.Content: Great room, just enough space for four in a double! The beds were comfortable and there was a really nice TV and a roomy bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham NYC Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: kathy r
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights recently at the Wyndham NYC Chelsea. Wow what a great place. Right in the heart of all you go to NYC for. Since we had gotten a great rate, we didn't expect the high quality experience we enjoyed at the hotel. From the moment we walked in the door until we picked up our bags from the bell hop who held them so we could extend our last day in the city after checkout, the staff definitely wowwed our small group. A few of us had stayed at the Four Seasons and Sofitel in the past and felt like the service of the Wyndham staff was on par with those hotels. The accommodations were very good. Small as you'd expect in NYC but upscale, comfortable and contemporary. We particularly liked the bed and bed linens. Bathroom was reminiscent of small hotels in Paris where we've stayed. Other than the staff possibly the best part is that you walk outside your door stroll half a block to the treats at Eataly (a reason in itself to go to NYC), we took in a wine tasting (divine), and then two don't miss parks short walks away (one at the end of the street and the other two blocks south on Broadway). Surrounded by great restaurants we took in a few including Pipas at ABC (short walk from the Wyndham) and ABC Kitchen -- new for us and wonderful as well. Of course, we saw two TV stars at the restaurant so one of our group got an NYC cheap thrill. Bottom line on our next trip we'd have a hard time not staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quick business trip”
Reviews.Author: Gazoo68
Reviews.Content: Ez check in. Small lobby, help was efficient and spoke english! Elevator was quick. Room, mine on 18th , the top floor, was small, but clean. Very quiet. Easy to get to, right off 6th ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: QUtraveler
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money in NYC. The room we had was small but we also did not pay much for Thanksgiving week in NYC ($200/nt) with free internet and safe on street parking. Even though we were visiting family in Chelsea, we traveled throughout the city quickly and easily from 5th Ave and 24th . All the subways are on 23th street as is shopping, restaurants, movies. The hi-line is nearby too. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Would stay there again. The bedding was so good I am going out to look for a new bed for my home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Netanablue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with Madison square park a 100 metres up the road,stunning at night. I found my room to be very comfortable,the bed being especially comfortable,the room being very spacious with a well set out bathroom.I found the house keeping staff to be very friendly and thorough in cleaning my room, always a pleasure to come back to. The front desk staff were also very friendly and helpful with anything.A great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: twoeyeswild
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is a very nice hotel with a very good sized shower and bathroom and the room was large by cpmparison to every hotel we have stayed in during prior trips to Chelsea where our son lives. Friendly staff, internet included and very nice location. We've decided this is our favorite and will e the place we will come back to many times. The price is very good as well for the square footage. There is a nice but tight fitness room with two tread mills and an eliptical in between that is open with your key card 24 hours a day. Dean from Myrtle Beach

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: jodamo
Reviews.Content: Good location, comfortable rooms, but very small. It's Manhattan so $300/night doesnt get you much. If you are out and about all day and just need a place to crash, it's perfect. But if you can spend a bit more, you can get a considerably nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average tourist-class hotel; very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: timminn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 2-night business trip. The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. The location is not great but alright. The room was quite small and hard to move around in, as others have said, but the bed was comfortable and everything was very clean. Noise problem with the air unit, but without it you hear everything in the rooms around you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: SoVTers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a Sunday night to be ready for business meetings early Monday AM. The staff was very friendly knowlegeable & accommodating. The area was quiet, and had a nice neighborhood feel to it. Just on the edge of Chelsea, there are plenty of places to eat & browse. Easy to get to & from the major interest points in the city. We had 1 minor problem with our room, which was quickly remedied to our satisfaction. We were pleasantly surprised to learn at check out that we had been given a 10% credit for our inconvenience. Overall, a very comfortable room, great bed & bath, and attentive staff. A satisfying stay. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoS_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip. The location was perfect, close to the subway stop and convenient to get to. The front desk staff was very friendly and always remembered my name from the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out. They were also very knowledgeable about the area and recommendations were good. Be sure to grab a good slice of NY Pizza around the corner. The room was clean, comfortable and decorated nicely. Good size rooms for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vincent K
Reviews.Content: I travel to the City frequently for businessand stumbled upon this hotel by accident. What a pleasant surprise. Staff is outstanding, rooms are exceptionally clean, beds are extremely comfortable. Overall, a great package at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: TradeShowHo
Reviews.Content: The staff are awesome. Lovely people from start to finish. Great location and nice, clean rooms. What else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: PRGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very welcoming and helpful throughout my stay. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable (king size with great duvet and lots of pillows). Bathroom is small (no bath), but clean and has hairdriers etc. Hotel decor is slightly dated, but doesn't impact on the stay. The hotel was quiet. The location is great for shopping on 5th Ave etc and near enough to the subway to get up and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: BethanieKay
Reviews.Content: Finally, a decent hotel in Manhattan! I’m almost hesitant to give this hotel a great review, because selfishly, I don’t want it to become so popular that I’m unable to book it myself the next time I’m in NYC :) In all seriousness, though, this hotel deserves a great review. There are so many awful hotels in NYC – run down, old, ugly, dirty, uncomfortable and all of that for a disgustingly expensive rate … but this one is actually a diamond in the rough. The hotel is located in Chelsea, right near the famous Flatiron building. It was a perfect location for me, as it was only 3 blocks from where my business meeting was, but it may be a bit far for tourists, depending on what area of the city they want to be in. Regardless, the subway is never too far away in NYC, if walking isn’t an option. The building itself is rather small and narrow, but it’s brightly colored and modern looking. Each floor only has about 8 rooms, so it’s not a huge hotel by any means; it felt more like a boutique hotel, with the benefit that it’s operated as part of the Wyndham chain (a bonus as far as quality, and loyalty programs). There is a restaurant next door which provides meals and even room service, and there was a small patio out front for dining and drinking. There was also a small reach-in cooler with snacks and drinks for purchase in the small (but bright and cheery) front lobby, with an internet station for those who need it. I had a room with a King bed on a mid-level floor, facing the back (not the street). It was a small room (typical of NYC), but I was pleasantly surprised at how clean and updated the room was. The large bed was very comfortable, with lots of pillows and a nice cushy down coverlet. There was also a comfortable work desk with complimentary wired internet (almost unheard of in NYC!) and 2 small complimentary bottles of water (nice touch!), a flat screen TV mounted to the wall, a small safe in the nightstand, and a stand-alone wardrobe, which had iron/ironing board and coffee/tea making machine inside. The bathroom was updated with modern fixtures, it had nice soft towels, a hairdryer, and “True Blue” bath amenities by Bath & Body Works (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, mouthwash, 2 kinds of soap, shower cap and ‘grooming kit’ – an impressive array for a mid-range hotel). The hotel was surprisingly quiet (or, I just lucked out and had quiet neighbors), and I thought it was in a good part of town. I was even pleasantly surprised that about an hour after I’d checked in, the front desk representative personally called up to my room to see if I was happy with the room, and if there was anything else I needed. She also reminded me that the temperature control was on the wall rather than on the device by the window (which was nice, as I was just trying to figure that out!). The air-conditioning is really just about the only ‘negative’ thing I experienced in my stat at this hotel – and it’s really not something I’d grade the hotel too harshly on. I couldn’t get the room to a comfortable temperature at night; the room was either too hot or too cold. That may have been an issue with the thermostat, but considering all the other good things about this hotel, I didn’t really want to harp on that. The room rate was a little high (ok, a lot high) for my personal preference if I had been on a leisure trip, but it was on par for what I’m willing to pay for a business trip. Overall, this was a great find, and I will definitely try to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch service, excellent comfy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: united07
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and had a smooth check-in. The rooms were clean, fairly large and the king bed was big and comfy. The free wireless and wired internet was a major plus. The service staff were on top form throughout my visit, always with a big smile and willing to do whatever it took to make our visit a memorable one. I definitely recommend this hotel to all types of travellers, whether you are a couple, on business trip, or just chilling with friends in New York City. The rates are decent if you book early enough.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: DCprofessor_11
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Garden in Chelsea lacks some traditional hotel amenities (i.e., a lobby), but it makes up for that with friendly, efficient service and small but nicely laid out and appointed rooms. The adjoining restaurant (Italian) is good and there is also a massive Eatally just a block away with many food options.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, wonderful room!”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday afternoon. We'd made reservations a couple of weeks earlier, and when we arrived, our room was upgraded to a suite. While the rooms were small compared to something you might find in a less congested city, this one had all the amenities and was very comfortable. The service, from checking in to checkout, was incredible. The staff members were all very friendly, yet professsional, and our experience couldn't have been better. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but value / $ leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Hubwanderer
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location and staff.... but - the room was tiny, cheap towels in the bathroom, noisy HVAC unit in the room kept us up all night. I know rooms in NYC are expensive, but for $400 a night was expecting something a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean”
Reviews.Author: kittygenovese
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Wyndham Chelsea. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room and bathroom were very clean. We showed up at 10:45am and they found a room that was ready for us. The cold breakfast buffet for $7.50 was a good deal - fruit, coffee cakes, toast, yogurt, cereal, fresh(!) OJ, and real, strong coffee. The location is great to walk to the Village, the High Line, Chelsea Market, and several subway lines to take you anywhere in the city. Free wifi, plenty of hot water in the shower, no crammed-on charges on the bill, no rude surprises. I had booked here based on the price and location and I was not sorry. Of course hotel rooms in NYC are small and plain; if you're spending your time in your NYC hotel room looking at the walls or hanging out in the lobby - you're doing it wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: VelhoSorriso
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location of this Wyndham hotel: close to Eataly, the subway, Tappo pizza, and Madison Square Park. Kudos for the attentive staff, and friendly service. We traveled with my elderly parents, so requested an accessible room for them, which had a king bed. My parents were unimpressed with the appointed space, so staff kindly relocated us to Room 1404 with double beds. Sadly, none of the beds were that comfortable although piled high with pillows (a choice of soft to firm would be appreciated); many in our party had trouble sleeping. While there is a deal for breakfast at the adjoining San Rocco, we found the space dark and cramped with questionable decor for our family of 6; however, a friend and I did enjoy colorful al fresco Negroni cocktails. P.S. Don't count on the contracted concierge to provide transportation - we had specifically requested (and prepaid) for a minivan as my Dad has trouble stepping up to a regular van. Sunday morning, 7 AM, a regular van arrived. To their credit, the Wyndham management kindly apologized, escalated the matter to the Apple Commuter owner, and generously offered to compensate, exhibiting the top-notch professional service noted above.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: rachelaumack
Reviews.Content: We just visited from New Jersey over Labor Day weekend. Wyndham Garden Chelsea was in a great location, a block from Eataly (check that place out!), Madison Square Park, a short walk to mass transportation. And I can't say enough about their service. We arrived early in the morning (10:30) expecting to give our bag to the concierge, but our room was ready and we checked in - very helpful! They offered services to find entertainment or restaurants, they checked up on us - just very nice. Hope you enjoy your visit there!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the staff!”
Reviews.Author: MissRosanne
Reviews.Content: Yesi checked me in, was SUPERB in giving me all the necessary information regarding my stay, and surrounding areas. Then both Jeff and Courtenay were EXCELLENT at providing me with wonderful places to eat, and easy walks to shopping areas etc. The staff alone made my stay here 5+ stars

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and some rude staff”
Reviews.Author: mancduck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location being a hop, skip and a jump away from the Flat Iron Building. The rooms, for New York, aren't a bad size and there is room to move in the bathrooms. Although there are only 2 lifts we rarely had to wait very long and they are a decent size. Then the negatives........ On check in a quiet room was specifically asked for. The room we were given had an air conditioning vent outside the door which was rathernoisy and irritating and went 24/7. I spoke to a helpful chap at reception who said that we could move room the following day (it was getting quite late at this point and we didn't want to pack to move that night) The following morning we went to talk to the females at reception and they sorted out a new room. We got up there and it was mich quieter so imagine our shock when we got back that night to find that it sounded like a plane was taking off in the room. It was literally vibrating. Every few minutes it would swich off then come back again. I think it was an air con unit for the adjoining building. I wanted to sob. All we wanted was a quiet room. I accept that there are sirens, traffic noise etcin cities but this was beyond what I would expect in any hotel regardless of location. I went and mentioned it to the guy on reception and was basically called a liar. On another occassion our keys stopped working but rather than apologise I was told it was my fault as I must have had it with a credit card (which I hadn't). This level of customer service I find unacceptable. We also had issues with a broken shower curtain rail but this was fixed promptly. If you want a hotel in this location and are heavy sleepers then it's fine, I personally would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Hotel, EXCELLENT Price, Our ONLY Manhattan place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RBrown8090
Reviews.Content: PRICE: EXCELLENT price, Great value for the money ACCOMMODATIONS: CLEAN, COMFORTABLE, Nicely appointed STAFF: FRIENDLY, HELPFUL, Courteous, Attentive We will no longer stay at any other hotel in Manhattan. I can not think of a single negative about this hotel. With it being less than 2 blocks to THREE different subway lines.... location could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price - I´ll return without any doubt”
Reviews.Author: Dawn L
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I stayed at this hotel but it was a very pleasant experience. The room (1806) was comfortable (decent sized compared to other hotels I´ve stayed at in NY) , clean (no bed bugs) and well equipped (tv, wi-fi, safe, AC). Quiet also. Beds are comfortable (even though I found the mattress to be too soft for my taste) but spacious, I also liked the different selection of pillows that they gave me. I found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. They were willing to help me work out best itineraries for certain days and they made wonderful recommendations for restaurants. Lobby is small but I´m not a fan of hanging around lobbies, so it wasn´t a problem. I´ll definitely stay at this hotel the next time I´m in town. .

Reviews.Title: “"Nice, but," describes it exactly.”
Reviews.Author: rhdachis
Reviews.Content: Tiny shower stall is not for the large-framed, or even the medium-framed. The room was clean upon arrival, but housekeeping was lax during the stay. Definitely not for the family....two very careful and considerate people could co-exist in the room, but forget about a child. The neighborhood is super cool, though, and there's plenty to see, eat, and shop for right around the corner. Staff was friendly and promptly replaced the dirty iron that streaked my friend's shirt.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel for Price”
Reviews.Author: bettyboopsf1
Reviews.Content: Arrived in NY to help move my sister into her place since she was moving out to NY for grad school. We were able to get 1 of the king bed suites at this place and it was a great deal and space for us. There were a total of 4 adults and 1 baby and the suite worked out perfectly since it had 2 spaces - 1 room with a king bed and another with the full size sleeper + a desk, in room fridge, microwave, safe and our own small balcony. Although the suite wasn't huge in comparison to other cities, I would consider it big by NY standards :). The staff were all very great and helped us bring our luggage up and down since we had quite a bit of it and they were able to accommodate our very early arrival since we took a red-eye in from San Francisco. There was even a nice handwritten note from Jeff the manager slipped under our door on the first night of our arrival (although the note regarding the complimentary snacks was a bit confusing b/c we weren't sure if that was for the 1st day only and if it was for the snacks by the front desk or if we were supposed to have snacks in the room for us on that first date). All in all, the hotel was in a great location in Chelsea - close by the subway to get to Times Square and anywhere else we needed to get to, walkable to the Macys and shopping at 34th & Broadway and it was nice to be right by Madison Square Park, and the famous Flatiron building. It was also nice to have Eataly right down the street for some great Italian foods. Plus it was nice to have a hotel that was away from all the hustle and bustle so that you wouldn't hear it all night but at the same time it was easy enough to get anywhere we needed to get to quickly. I would definitely recommend this hotel again for anyone looking for a hotel that can accommodate a visiting family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was decent, my room was fairly clean but the top sheet was stained but OK I'll live. Then at 5am the smoke alarm low battery alert when off. When I called downstairs I was asked to disconnect it myself and leave it in the hallway because she was all alone. But she promised to let the Hotel manager know. It's a 17 floor hotel in NY and there is only one person staffed over night!? When i went to check out they couldn't have cared less. All the desk person could do was offer me complimentary breakfast. Which is already included! nah not again

Reviews.Title: “A New York Gem”
Reviews.Author: HTrebels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find and an absolute gem. Superbly located, friendly and helpful staff and the rooms were actually a decent size for a NY hotel. I highly recommend this lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Love the service & will be back”
Reviews.Author: Danpak15
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Hotel was amazing! A few friends and I made a trip to New York recently and stayed at this place for 3 nights. The service was spectacular. The front desk offered helpful advice on places to go and things to eat. The location was also very convenient because everything was within walking distance. Whenever you're in New York, definitely make it a point to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good decision”
Reviews.Author: JZolnierczyk
Reviews.Content: I went to New York city just as a fun trip this summer with my brother and my cousin. We had a pretty hard time booking a hotel because everything was so expensive and when we would check the hotel reviews all we ever saw were bad ones, until we scrolled down to this one on Hotels.com. We got a pretty good deal on out room and the room was very clean when we arrived. We didn't really spend very much time in our room as we were out and bout most of the day meeting with friends and just being tourists but we were always pleased when we came back to our room. The service was also something that made our trip so wonderful. When we arrived we were greeted by two employees at the front desk and we were checked in very quickly and were able to enter our room immediately. The hotel is rather small with only about eight rooms per floor so there wasn't very much staff required but they were always around and all of the employees were very friends and just made the experience a very good one. Another bonus for us was that the hotel does have a shuttle service that takes guests to the airport if they need to get a ride, unfortunately there wasn't a shuttle service at the time we needed one but the woman at the concierge desk was very happy to reserve a private car for us. Overall, it was a great place to stay at it was in my favorite part of Manhattan, I don't think we could have stayed anywhere better. The only problem I did have was the elevator was sometimes unavailable because it was being used to bring down trash and laundry but thankfully we were only staying on the 6th floor so it was pretty easy to use the stairs! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious, but functional”
Reviews.Author: MongoSchwartz
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Garden offers simple accommodations with a minimum of frills. The lobby is small and congested, so if there are several people coming/going/checking in--as there was when I checked in--it can be a bit of a mob scene. And for those of you who might need a business center--or even just a station to print out a airline boarding pass--there's a small computer shoehorned into the corner of the lobby as well. Such "busyness" also lends itself to some frustration. The two elevators are routinely in service (often by cleaning staff), resulting in long waits up and down. If your room is on a lower floor, you'd be better off taking the stairs. Also, housekeeping tends to work well into the afternoon and early evening, leaving towels/sheets stacked or piled in the hallways and stairs throughout the day. Normally this wouldn't be a big deal, but when exiting the elevator, there isn't a lot of room in the hallways to maneuver. The room itself was fine. The flat screen TV was a nice feature, and the work area well lighted and comfortable. The only downside (and one to be aware of) is that my room--on the 5th floor--faced out to the street. It was very noisy at night, and especially late at night when garbage trucks were making their noisy rounds. You may want to ask in advance how removed (or not) your room is relative to such activity.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mkswenty
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Super customer service and the perfect location. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: SFLtraveler27
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a wedding last weekend, and took in some of the sights as well. Got an amazing rate at the Wyndham website, and had a very enjoyable 4-night stay. The room was small, but nice. Flat screen TV, very comfortable bed, and great window shades if you decide you want to sleep in. A/C worked excellently, which was important on the hottest weekend in the city in recent times, according to the news. Cleaning staff was great, in and out before you could notice them, and they wouldn't bother you if you put the card on the doorknob. Front desk staff was personable, efficient, and always greeted you with a smile and a 'hello.' Location was great, just off 6th Ave and up a block from 23rd St. Cannot think of one thing that I was unhappy with or even disappointed by during my 4-day weekend here. Will definitely stay again on future trips to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else in NYC but here!”
Reviews.Author: joolseyc09
Reviews.Content: This place really is an excellent deal for the price you pay. It's an easy walk from this hotel to bars and shopping in West Village, Chelsea, and Greenwich Village. The rooms are on the smaller side, but who spends waking hours in their hotel room when visiting NYC? Not a big deal. The room was fastidiously clean, and the bed I slept in was the most comfortable thing I've ever slept on. The front desk staff were gracious and polite. I'm so glad I found this place, and will not think of staying anywhere else when I visit Manhattan in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: St0rm9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for four days and were very impressed first of all with the location of the hotel. It's a block away from the Flat Iron building, five blocks away from the Empire State building, nine blocks away from Union Square...you couldn't ask for a better location for the price. And the hotel room, while a tad small, was very clean, the bed was nice and comfortable, and the bathroom was also neat and fresh. Definitely a great hotel to stay at to be in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: madre15
Reviews.Content: It's not often that you can stay three nights in a Manhattan hotel for under $600. Our room was fine and spacious by New York standards. Free Wi-Fi was also available. Great neiborhood with lots of restaurants nearby. The subway was nearby and taxis were always available when we wanted to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel I've stayed at in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: StPark
Reviews.Content: This is a truly excellent choice for staying in Manhattan. Terrific location near the Flat Iron building, clean rooms and extremely polite and helpful staff. I managed to get a nightly rate of about $126 plus tax from one of the booking sites, but even at the full price of $180 pn (I think) it's still good value. The rooms are a little small, though not overly so for New York. I really won't stay anywhere else in NY from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: bluelight_11
Reviews.Content: The staff really make the place here - attentive, understanding and really try to cater to your preferences. I have stayed here numerous times for business, and every time I return they call me by name. One particular woman, Alisa, always remembered me and did her best to get me into my preferred rooms. Even going so far as to move me halfway through my stay when the room became available. When you're in a hotel for over a week this is really appreciated! Downsides: there are only a couple of rooms with bathtubs. The pillows could be a bit more comfortable. If you have an iphone or laptop that leaves the hotel you'll have to re-agree to internet service guidelines every time you connect (very annoying on the iphone). Upsides: Great staff. The location is very easy - convenient to subways, 10 minute walk to Union Square, and now one block from Eataly (the new Italian market/eating/drinking place). The toiletries are very nice, and always refilled. Cleaning staff does a great job. Also, they have the Showtime channel. Overall, highly recommended! Good value for your money.... Especially in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “If was fine BUT”
Reviews.Author: africanroots
Reviews.Content: On check-in Courtney was most friendly and professional - for the rest of BOTH by stays the staff were unresponsive and dismissive - when reporting that I felt unsafe with a safe that was not secured to the wall as I travel with huge amounts of cash - I was informed that all rooms are provided with PORTABLE SAFES and that this was standard practice - I have a photo of my friend actually walking out of the room with the safe containing all our passports and $3000 in cash just to show how ludicrous this is. The hotel is central but lacks any sort of atmosphere - I stayed in 2 different roomsand checked all the lobbies - each have 2 framed pictures against the wall and above the bed - and both are IDENTICAL - they could at least swop one from the hall with one from each room excetera - just shows no thought given to much else than functionality

Reviews.Title: “EXC ROOMS !! FRIENDLY STAFF !! PERFECT LOCATION !!”
Reviews.Author: stevince
Reviews.Content: Rooms were CLean as a Whistle ! View was Great & Slept PERFECTLY.. Staff VERY Friendly & Accomodating.. Always said HI whether I was coming or going ! Free WIFI too ! DEF a place to stay ! Walked all over Chelsea, W Village & Midtown..

Reviews.Title: “Great price value”
Reviews.Author: jthad
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and wonderful staff all wrapped up in great price

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: AlexMontreal
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC for a bachelor party weekend. The location was perfect, right in mid-town, close enough to get to SoHo, Little Italy and Meatpacking, and not a far walk from Times Square and other sights (one exception was Yankee Stadium). Overall it was well kept, the staff was friendly, the rooms and bathroom were a bit small but clean and modern, and hey when you're in NY you're not really supposed to spend much time in your room. The little bar next door was a good option (though we only had a quick drink there one night). Special thanks to the 2 gents who worked in the evening/night (sorry I can't remember your names) they were very helpful with restaurants and clubs and getting around. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Kim M
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a girls weekend with my friends. It's a nice place. Rooms are a little small but when you're only there to sleep, it's not a big deal. There's a cute little restaurant/bar right next to it, Starbucks & Eatily just up the street. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient business hotel”
Reviews.Author: oakye
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as it was one of the closest hotels to headquarters for work. Yes, small rooms, but that's NYC. + Friendly, accommodating staff + Small but otherwise fine fitness center (it's a tiny room with 1 set of free weights, 1 elliptical machine, 2 treadmills, and a water cooler.). If you're looking for room to actually use those weights or stretch, you'll need to get creative as there's no weight bench or much floor space. On the positive side, no one else was there using it when I was there. + free wifi + close to a nice pizza place a few doors down + room had no odors - I did discover some stained topsheets (eww) but it would appear inconsistently throughout my stay. Some days the sheets were fine, another day - they'd appear. - When I first arrived, the shower curtain had a strong musty towel order... I'd already put my things down and didn't want to change rooms (though the front desk was more than willing to help there). The next day, first thing when the cleaning people arrived, they changed the curtain and resolved the issue

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for seeing New York”
Reviews.Author: mikesupple
Reviews.Content: Staying in NYC for my brother's bachelor party. This hotel is ideally located for easy access to everything we wanted to see and do in New York. And if anybody is looking for easy ways to get in and out of New Jersey (gasp) the PATH is only one block away too. Extremely friendly staff on check-in and check-out. Very clean, quiet and comfortable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Lunar2000
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay here over a weekend. The staff during the day are extremely helpful and friendly. The night shift crew a little less so but they werent rude. The rooms are small. This is partially expected due to location but don't expect to bring and be able to fit more than a 2 large suitcases with you. This place is in a great area with lots of parks and easy train access to things like empire states building and times square. Room was clean and cleaning staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: micheletrayes
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and in a nice, convenient Chelsea location. The front desk staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY good!”
Reviews.Author: lecarlos
Reviews.Content: I took my parents to NY for father's day weekend. I usually stay in smaller, cheaper hotels in the upper west side, but since I was bringing my family I wanted something a little nicer. It was my first time staying here and I was pleasantly surprised (and so were my parents.) The rooms and bathrooms were clean and specious. The location was excellent, too. Not by all the craziness, but not far from it and the subway was only a couple steps away. One thing I was really happy about was the service. We booked a room with two double beds, but by the time we checked-in they were all gone. Without thinking it twice the guy at the desk said they were giving us two rooms with king beds instead. We had a similar situation with another hotel last year and they didn't take care of us like these guys did. Will definitely be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JontyNIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndam Garden at the end of May this year as part of a holiday to New York and Florida. I was a lttle apprehensive about the accommodation but I shouldnt have. We had a great stay at this hotel. The room was a reasonable size and was well equipped, and it was spotless. We stayed with our daughter and the room was sufficient for the three of us. It was a good location to visit the city and you have all that you need by way of coffee shops and food outlets to meet your needs. The hotel staff were excellent and exptremely helpful nothing was a bother. I have and would recomment this hotel to others and i look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: rplove5662
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I were here for 4 nights in May and found the hotel to be very clean, comfortable, and accommodating. There is no hotel restaurant, however there is a spendy Italian resaurant right next door which had delicious food and drinks. Down the block there are several delis and you can grab a sandwich or breakfast easily. Subway is easy to get to. Flatiron building is just down the street and the Empire State Building is very close. The staff was helpful--they brought us up extra hangers and also sold fruit and water in the lobby. Small rooms but I have never found a large room in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - will be back there next time”
Reviews.Author: flolively
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!! perfect location, excelent service. room was comfortable and clean. I recomend this hotel is absolutely awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Helped in wedding party overbook crisis! love em!”
Reviews.Author: priscilla1227
Reviews.Content: They were so kind and very helpful in getting rooms not only for myself but other wedding party people and guests that were not "confirmed" and rooms given away...the day before the wedding. Great welcome and stay! so friendly ...and clean!! great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to become a regular!”
Reviews.Author: KelleySmithStyle
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here and it was just as good as the first. Easy to book, easy to check out. SUPER friendly front desk staff, especially Winnie. Rooms are clean and set up nicely. I love the quiet location and the cozy lobby. As long as the price continues to work with my budget, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great location, all-around awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon1014
Reviews.Content: Wyndham Garden Hotel is a very nice boutique hotel with great service, every staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I got 2 rooms for friends and family, a kings suite and a 2-doubles bed room, both were very very clean (looks almost brand new), decent size, and well accommodated with the usual hotel supplies and amenities. Housekeeping also does a very good job tidying up the room, and replacing towels, sheets, etc. I've seen other hotels in which their housekeeping always leave a few things undone/dirty, the housekeeping in Wyndham Garden does an exact perfect work every time, leaving the room sparkly clean. The hotel is also in a great location, 5 minute walk to union square, and right next to madison square park, which as a Shake Shack in it. 10 minute walk to Korean town for all the k-bars and restaurants, 15 minute walk to times square for all your shopping needs. Subway station is 1 block from the hotel, super convenient. All-around great experience with the city and with the hotel. Definitely would recommend to all my friends and family on their next NY trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel1660878
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our two kids, ages 6 and 8, at this Wyndham in May 2011, and were impressed by the staff's effort to make us comfortable and happy. There is free wifi for all guests which is a lovely perk to staying here; in addition, we wanted to save money by eating cereal with the kids in the mornings, and the staff quickly borrowed bowls and spoons for us from the restaurant downstairs, and stored our milk in the employee fridge each night, and delivered it to us each morning. The staff is great!!

Reviews.Title: “first stop in new york”
Reviews.Author: giorgettisimana11
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Garden Hotel Manhattan was our first stop in New york for our honey moon. We really loved it!!! His central location was basilar because we wanted to walk to visit the city. The rooms were big and clean. We really appreciated that there was a ketlee because we like drinking infusions before going to sleep. The staff was polite. Fantastic was also the idea that it was an environment friendly hotel. We'll go back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Many stays and I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: JoeAnonymous
Reviews.Content: A hotel room needs 3 things: 1. A quiet room, 2. A comfortable bed, 3. A hot shower. The Wyndham hits a homeroom on all 3. It is a hidden treasure in midtown Manhattan. The rates are reasonable (for Manhattan!) and the rooms are quiet, clean and efficient. I've been a frequent business traveller for 12 years and this is the first time I'v actually known a hotel to read and listen to the customer survey. I usually fill those things out for complaints not expecting any real action but the two minor complaints were both resolved very quickly. The staff are the soul of the hotel and this Wyndham has plenty of fun and gracious soul! The rooms may be small but this is Manhattan and the value for money is spot on. The quietest rooms are in the back.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Anikabella
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at a Wyndham Hotel before but I can guarantee that I will be back. If all the Wyndham hold the same amount of friendly service, I will make it a priority to stay at these hotels. For this trip, I initially tried to book a room at another Wyndham location and since it was full, the website redirected me to this location. For NYC, the price was right. Even on a long weekend (easter), they let us have a reduced rate (which I had found a coupon for online). For anyone who knows how expensive NYC hotels are, this was great for us. Our online price quoted (with taxes) was the exact same as when we checked-out. The location of this hotel is very well situated, between 5th and 6th Ave, at 24th street with two different subway line within a block distance. We walked all the way to statue of liberty one day, and another day, up to 96th street, halfway up to Central Park. Having our hotel right in the middle of Manhattan was great as all the neighbourhoods are easily accessible, even by walking. Keeping up with NYC’s style, the lobby, the elevators, the gym and the rooms are all very small but they all serve their purpose. We arrived to NYC at 11am and were given a room instantly at no extra charges. We had been told ahead of time that we could leave our luggage with the front desk while we went sight-seeing if a room wasn’t ready when we got there. We were given a room with a king sized bed on the 4th floor, with a window facing the front street. There was a flat screen TV on the wall, a small chair, desk, closet, a safe, an alarm clock, two phones and a full bathroom. We never heard any sounds coming from the hallway, neighbours or streets. The bed was very comfortable and the room very clean. 20 minutes after our check-in, the front desk called us to ask if everything was good and if we required anything else. Throughout our weekend, the front desk asked us if we needed help finding our way around, suggestions to restaurants or if we required shuttle service to the airports. Very nice personal touch that we appreciated. We parked our car on the streets (for free – it was the weekend) and didn’t have a problem. I know the hotel does have parking for a fee though… We also were able to flag down a cab within a minute on 5th or 6th avenue at any time of the day or night and the subways come by very often. The Hotel offers free wi-fi throughout the hotel (even in your room) and it worked perfectly. They also have a computer with free internet that you can use in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice, clean, not overpriced hotel with friendly staff in NYC. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pretty27
Reviews.Content: Doesn't get much better than this for a well-priced boutique hotel in NYC...awesome location across the street from Eataly, the new Italian marketplace...if you haven't been already, you must go! A 2-minute walk to the Flatiron building, and a 10-minute walk from abc home and other Chelsea shops. A tiny but packed fitness room, in room tea and coffee, refrig. and microwave; bathroom amenities are plentiful and quite nice...there are flat screen tv's in all of the rooms and the very friendly front desk folks just can't be more helpful in terms of recommending restaurants, shops, plays, etc. I highly recommend this place for the value and location...you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Persistentd
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights on business. Room was comfortable and very clean. Happier once I found the thermostat on wall by wardrobe. Room was at back of hotel and very quiet so great for a good nights sleep. Coffee making facilities, iron and board was a nice touch. Reception staff were only too pleased to help and nothing seemed too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls with noisy housekeeping and guests--bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: MissJay73
Reviews.Content: Average room--nothing exciting. Housekeeping is very loud in the morning with chatter and equipment. I had to listen to a full morning gossip fest while laying in bed. Also had the pleasure of listening to music from the room next door until 2am--who really needs sleep during a business trip? I called the front desk to complain about the music and a constant crackling noise in the wall (went on all night)--nothing they could do to help me out, the hotel was sold out. Bring earplugs is you're planning to stay here. I won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfy, good location”
Reviews.Author: julientheworld
Reviews.Content: Fun location in heart of Chelsea, room was clean and comfortable, front desk staff friendly and helfpul. The room has what you need including a good bed, cable TV, plasma on wall and a roomy bathroom (for Manhattan). I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and trip!”
Reviews.Author: robinmstl
Reviews.Content: It was hard to find a hotel in NYC that didn't have horrible reviews of bed bugs and rude staff. If you're like me, you read reviews and really depend on people to give you the honest truth. Well it's no wonder this hotel is rated so well. From now on every time I visit NYC, I will be staying at this hotel. Very clean, modern, friendly and the best location. It's very central and walkable. I love the fact that we were so close to Eataly, which is a great place to visit. I will suggest this to eveyone!

Reviews.Title: “This is a horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: billmann1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was one of the few hotels in Manhattan with rooms available. Now I understand why they had rooms available. Next time I'll stay in New Jersey. First, the lobby is tiny. Nothing more than a desk with two people behind it, a small table, and a concierge tucked away in a small corner. The lobby couldn't have been more than 15 feet by 15 feet. The check in was slow, and even with two groups in front of me, I had to stand in the doorway, as there wasn't enough room for me to fit in the lobby. The rooms aren't much better. They are very small, even by Manhattan standards. (And be sure not to get an ADA-compliant room if you need to work - those don't come with desks). The room was clean, although one day the housekeeper forgot to give me towels, which I did not notice until after I was finished with my shower. The fitness room is even smaller than the lobby and the guest rooms. It has two treadmills and one elliptical machine, and a small set of dumbbells (although not enough room to use them). My head almost hit the ceiling using the elliptical. I hadn't stayed in a Wyndham for quite some time, so I was dismayed to learn that I had to choose between either receiving a morning newspaper or receiving points for my stay - I was not allowed to have both. This is incredible for a major hotel chain, but the employees could not have cared less. Overall, this was a very bad experience, and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick business trip...”
Reviews.Author: demodiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndham for a one night business trip. The staff was very friendly and helpful upon check-in. The rooms are very small (typical for NYC) but they make excellent use of space and it was very comfortable for the business traveler. Neat and clean with nice toiletries in the bathroom, a coffee maker and hotel safe. The breakfast in the associated restaurant next door was very nice and the location was convenient to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Best Nights Ever”
Reviews.Author: Archiholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family and a family friend, which meant that I needed two rooms. From previous experience at other hotels, it's usually difficult to get two rooms on the same floor, much less adjacent to each other. However, the front desk was able to accommodate our needs by booking us two VERY spacious rooms right next to each other, both with balconies! The hotel staff were very nice and made awesome after-business-hours suggestions, and the location is superb. Two major subway lines are within walking distance (even in the cold), and Eataly is right around the corner, facing the Flatiron Building. We went during the winter time, so we didn't walk around as much as we'd like, even though the area is very much walkable with many attractions and shopping opportunities. Overall this has been a very comfortable and cultural experience, and I would definitely pick Wyndham for my next visit. Good location, great price, knowledgable staff members - what more could I ask for? :)

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in Flatiron District; did the job”
Reviews.Author: dprreal
Reviews.Content: Recently spent the weekend in New York and stayed at the Wyndham Garden. The hotel was fine; small main lobby, easy check-in. Elevators were a bit small, and I shared them with a talkative service worker, but they were fine. Room was utilitarian but fine--the single King room was plenty big enough for me as a solo business traveler. Good power, decent wi-fi. Basically everything I expected. Recommended if you're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Slm24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great price and great stay!!! This was my first time actually staying overnight in New York and I would definitely go back and stay again! The hotel staff was very friendly, great location( not too far from times square), the rooms were very modern and clean (bed was super comfy). The restaurant in the hotel is amazing (try the shrimp). Overall very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Clean & Modern - Great value”
Reviews.Author: SaucyCardinal
Reviews.Content: All was excellent, especially decor and location. Only tiny complaint is that shower could be a bit more updated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “OK for brief stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jed3
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Wyndham Chelsea. It is a newer, small (!) hotel on a quiet NYC side street. We had a standard king-bed room. The 2 queen bed room costs more. The room was among the smallest that we have stayed in, at about 180 SF, including a corner bathroom. With a small desk, soft chair, and closet, there was not room for much else. The bathroom was just OK, with skimpy towels. A coffee making machine was in the closet, but no mini-fridge. Our rear-view rom was quiet, but less than pretty. I got this for $100 through Priceline when the least online was $149, so I was satisfied for one night. I would recomment it, but barely. The service people were very helpful and considerate of our requests.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler36942
Reviews.Content: It was great to visit NYC for the first time, and be helped and greeted by the wonderful staff at the Chelsea Wyndham hotel. The hotel is a small gem in a great location. The street was quiet, yet close to great dining places, subway, and main attractions. A parking garage was adjacent to the hotel building. The hotel room was small yet we did not mind it since we went there to get a good rest at night, which we really did!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; suite works for small family”
Reviews.Author: WAStraveler
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try the Chelsea neighborbood, and this was a good choice. Only one block from the new Eataly food hall, a real plus, and a block from beautiful Madison Park and subway, too. Two stops to Greenwich Village, and not far to Chelsea Market. When we returned from the holiday madness of Rockefeller Center area, felt a sense of calm here. Bed particularly comfy; living room area in suite big enough (barely) for two teens. Tiny lobby. Compliments to Claudia at the front desk, who made sure we had the extra pillows and blankets we needed. Concierge, however, not in the know. Snug & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Thiefs..don't leave money in bags”
Reviews.Author: gizmo_222
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed at this hotel in October 2010 for 3 days. Overall my stay was good (clean room and comfortable). The location of the hotel is really good and you can walk to all the main spots very easily. One problem was that check-in is very slow and i had to wait until about 5pm so that my room was ready. My main concern was that the day i left, my flight was only in the evening so i left my bags with the hotel. I had one laptop bag which i had forgotten that i left 200$ secured in one pocket. When i got to the airport in the evening and opened my laptop bag, i realized that somebody from the hotel had gone thru all the pockets of my bag and turned my bag into a real mess. The 200$ was missing... I've been to many hotels around the world and this is the first time this happens to me. For this reason i cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_travellers201
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel 10/10 not a terrible review, it would not let me select anything other than 1/5. The hotel was nice and cosy. The staff were helpful. If you don't mind walking around then this hotel is conveniently located with a short walk to Macy's, we also walked to central park (~45 minute walk) even though everyone thought we were crazy. There are stores on the way to central park so it gives you something to do. 2 blocks away is a pizza place "2 bros" where you can get 99c slices of pizza, there is also a pharmacy/convenient store around the corner. I would definately stay at the hotel again. Last time we stayed opposite Madison square gardens and paid a fortune for a crappy room, if you want a nice room the Wyndham chelsea is definately a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: apreech
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Wyndham Garden Hotel on the 2nd December for a 4 night stay, the holiday was booked through a travel agent, when we got there we only had the one room booked and 4 guests- the receptionist staff dealt with this very well and checked us in to another room very promptly. Every day going in and out of the hotel the staff were very polite and helpful. There is also someone on reception to book the taxi's/shuttle buses- these were good value and very quick and easy to book. The location of the hotel is perfect, we went out for a walk around the shops on our first day after a long flight and had only a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square and to the shops. We had breakfast and dinner in a nearby restaurant called Benvenuto- the staff were very polite and the food was very nice and very very good value. No sight of any bed bugs at all..! All in all a wonderful holiday and hotel- would love to go back again..!

Reviews.Title: “This place redefines hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: BillySquan
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to the Wyndham in Chelsea and the people who work there are the greatest! They always strive to make my stay special and they always succeed! the rooms are fresh and clean but the hospitality exhibited by the staff is unparalled! I have at numerous hotels around the world (including Four Seasons, Hyatts, Marriotts, etc) and i would put this on up against them all! Congratulations for understanding 'service' and living it!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Room at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: wmn9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here due to the price and walking distance to my meeting. Typical NYC Tiny Rooms. My room had a view of the ally, so it was quiet. For an overnight or even a couple of nights it would be ok. The restaurant next to the lobby had good appetizers

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LAGAL61
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I spent 4 days and 3 nights in NYC last weekend. After reading dozens of reviews and checking bedbug registry, I chose the Wyndham Garden for our first ever stay in New York. We were so pleased when we walked into our room. It looked exactly like the picture on their website. The bed was comfortable, the linens were soft and clean. The room was spotless!! I checked for bedbugs immediately and found none. The staff is friendly and helpful. The concierge gave us spot on advice for catching the correct subway and she booked our return shuttle to the airport. The close proximity to both downtown and uptown subways made this an ideal location. Our first night we walked to the Empire State building which is just blocks away. There is a conveniently located major drugstore, Starbucks and other food places nearby. The only minor complain I would have is the shower curtain is too short and if you are not extremely careful water gets all over the bathroom floor. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I like the hotel, but don't care too much for the bed bugs.”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: Besides the bed bugs and limited space... this would be a nice hotel. Let me start off by telling you what I liked about the Wyndham. Pretty appearance on the outside and located in a good location. Inside lobby is nice as well and they have very a friendly and helpful staff. First flaw you will notice is the very narrow hallways with bubbling carpet. When you enter your room, you will notice that it's as big as medium sized bathroom or large closet. But, keep in mind that most hotels in New York are similar in size. I had a very hard time sleeping due to the thin walls. I could hear my neighbors on the phone and people in the halls all night. No security at night so don't bother calling front desk at night because they only have one person on duty. Then there were the bed bugs. I noticed bug bites the first couple of night and thought that they were mosquitoes, then I found giant bed bugs under my pillow on my last night. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok - but don't plan on getting a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: momtobaseballboys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndham Chelsea Garden this past Monday night. Our room was ok - very clean, typically smaller for NYC. We had a double so there was not much room to walk around beds. Not even a chair to sit on other than the desk chair - which we used to hold one of our suitcases. The lobby was teansy - nothing other than high stools for guests to sit on. A comfy chair would have been nice. Our room must have been over what was a staging area for LOUD garbage trucks. They circled the street, reloaded and dumped ALL night under our room window. It was LOUD! We did not sleep at all!!!!! Maybe better quality windows would have helped. Or, offering to put guests on higher floors on garbage nights. Would not stay there again b/c of this issue. For $300/night, was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Just right.”
Reviews.Author: dayresidew
Reviews.Content: This hotel might not wow you with glitz and glamour, but it was just right for my two-night stay. The bed was super comfy, the location was perfect, and the staff was always courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: RNatha
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Garden Hotel is superbly located in the Flatiron District. It is near several subway lines, a park, and a hot new store, Eataly. While 24th Street is not particularly busy, the noise in our street-facing, fourth-floor room was a bit irritating. Fortunately, the congenial staff members relocated us for the remainder of our stay to a quieter and larger room toward the top of the building.

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: plc18
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend last summer with a friend of mine. The room is small, but very clean and well appointed. You have everything you need to enjoy the city. The location is great, and the staff is friendly. The night manager, Jeff, was very helpful and gave us some good restaurant and bar recommendations. Great experience for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: viaggitrice_ligure
Reviews.Content: It is very good value for money and in a very good location,no complaints, i could go again,it made my stay in NY very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location - just a couple of small glitches!”
Reviews.Author: LickleS
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay here recently, although there were a few small glitches which impaired the overall experience. The location of the hotel was great, just twenty blocks from Times Square and really close to the shops of Fifth Avenue and Broadway, so we were able to walk virtually everywhere or pop back to the hotel during the day to drop our shopping bags. We were greeted on arrival by a very friendly staff member who checked us in quickly and easily, before directing us to our room on the 14th floor.The room was a good size, especially as it contained two double beds, which were extremely comfortable. There was only one window which didn't seem to allow much light into the room, and strangely, apart from one small ceiling light just inside the doorway, there didn't seem to be any other ceiling lights in the room, so we resorted to having to switch on the two lamps provided. The room could have been cleaned slightly better before our arrival as there was some dirt on the carpet, but generally, the room was cleaned well each day during our stay. The bathroom towels and bed sheets were changed every three days, unless requested sooner by ourselves. The website stated that there was a safe in each room, which I had planned to use, as I had taken my laptop with us. However, after searching the room, we were surprised to find this missing. We mentioned this to the staff on reception, who asked us to check the room again, and if we still could not find the safe, he would arrange for one to be put in the following day. We checked the room again and informed him on the same day that there was no safe, but this was never brought to our room. I resorted to putting all my valuables back in my suitcase each morning and locking it when we left the room. We also had recurring problems connecting to the free wifi. The staff on the front desk were unable to help, but gave us the telephone number of their central technical support whom they informed us would be able to help instead. They were able to assist us, but the internet speeds were extremely slow once we were connected. On departure, the hotel concierge booked the shuttle to get us back to the airport. Firstly, the taxi bus arrived twenty minutes late, and secondly, the driver was extremely rude, only spoke basic English, and drove very erractically (even more so than the average yellow cab driver). The shuttle had already collected several passengers from other hotels and we were the last. Our suitcases were loaded onto the top of the pile in the boot, and when the driver braked sharply after yet another near-accident, all of the cases slid forward, falling onto the seat in front. Luckily, there was nobody sitting here, otherwise I fear a serious injury could have occurred. We both agreed it would have been a far more enjoyable journey, had we stood on the street and hailed a cab. If I was to make a return trip to New York, I would consider staying at Wyndham again as the price was very competitive, and generally it is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice For Budget Stay in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and would echo all of the positive comments in previous reviews. Wyndham means that there will be a certain standard of comfort...Great beds, flat screen TVs, large modern bathrooms. The basics are all covered here. Room is probably smaller than an average Wyndham room, but a little larger than a basic NYC hotel room. Good for sleeping, but you'll get claustrophobic if you have to spend alot of time in there. Front desk help was always friendly and clearly trying hard to connect with everyone who walked in which I appreciate. Maid Service was great and friendly to boot. (EXCEPT why always leaving DECAF for my coffee refills????) Hallway was really overheated for some reason, but AC in the room worked like a charm. My one pet peeve was the view. Last 2 times at a Wyndham in NYC with a view of a dark alley. Not a deal killer of course, but I guess I'll have to update my guest preference from Ugly View to Nice View. Anyhow, I think this is a really good value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Will return!”
Reviews.Author: timintoronto
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for four nights and have to say what a great hotel in its category!!!! Staff are wonderful! Always helpful and very pleasant! The manager had flowers waiting for us as per my request! Wife loved it! This hotel is very well run in every aspect and the beds are so so comfortable! Flat screen tvs are a very good size. Located near subway close to Madison park and the Flatiron building. In Madison park (2 minute walk) try Shake Shack for a great f(ast food) burger and fries! Ice cream milkshakes are also tops. Get the subway pass for $27 for 7 days if you are in town for more than two days and forget the taxis. This hotel is well located for the average tourist or even people on business since it is near enough to business district and the same distance to times square. Just a couple stops on the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Less than spectacular”
Reviews.Author: SCauwels
Reviews.Content: Starting off positive. Most of the staff was friendly and the price was reasonable for NYC. The conceirge folks were utterly useless and not friendly. This hotel lobby was under reconstruction with dust flying everywhere. It hurt my eyes just to check-in. The staff tried to make the best of the situation with Magnolia cupcakes and a 20% off discount for a future stay. The small rooms did not feel very clean and were not vacuumed often enough. We got some crumbs from our cupcakes on the floor that were there after the cleaning staff was in the room a day later. I was here on business and was not able to use wireless internet! The speedtest on their server was dismal and even though I talked with their technical staff it did not seem that any improvements could be made in the short term. I had to walk to the end of the block to work at the very busy Starbucks. I actually moved to multiple rooms to see if I could get internet better on the front side of the building. It only slightly improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: di-shaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights & were very happy. The rooms were spotless (& NO sign of bedbugs!) & the area convenient for exploring the city. The staff were without exception smiling, polite & helpful; we would single out for special mention Angie the concierge who was always happy to answer questions & do all she could for us, including checking in online for our journey home. A great place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “TINY, DEPRESSING & FILTHY!!”
Reviews.Author: clmacaluso
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Priceline, and when we arrived, we had to pay $40 to "upgrade" to 2 double beds. We ended up paying the going rate - no discount/benfit for using Priceline! The room was tiny (barely enough room to walk around the beds), and depressing (no pictures/decor). There was a flatscreen t.v. hung on a bare wall at the base of the two beds (no room for a dresser/table). The bathroom appeared to not have been cleaned - private hairs in the shower, on the floor and toilet! DISGUSTING! By the time we discovered this it was nearly 11pm.
