We just got in bed and prayed we wouldn'lt end up with bed bugs! Checked out first thing in the morning and informed the front desk. Said they'd let the manager know. NEVER AGAIN will I use Priceline for fear of ending up with this hotel again! Th

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Garden Hotel-very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: midnightrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights in total. Check in was very fast. Due to other reviews citing bed bugs, I did my due diligence and did a complete check of the bed. I realised that the pillow cases had not been changed. I called down to the main desk and within 10 minutes had 4 clean, ironed pillow cases delivered to my door. Apart from that the room was clean and our stay was without any other issues. The hotel is located between 5th and 6th Avenues. It is very convenient for walking and a subway station is 5minutes away. Across the street is a great Thai resturant that just reopened. I would go back to this hotel because of its location. The street is relatively quiet and you are not surrounded by a constant overload of touristy stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: skleib
Reviews.Content: The room was clean! Excellent location (close to subway, Madison Square Park, Chelsea Market, the Highline Park). Everyone on the staff was friendly and more than helpful. Accommodations were sufficient for the price of the hotel. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do you want bed bugs? If so, avoid the the WYNDHAM CHELSEA WEST”
Reviews.Author: lifebrand
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here from June 29- July 4, 2010. We were placed in Room 408. 1) The room was not vacuumed. This is was very digusting as there was pieces of hair and other particles on the carpet. I have to mention that I do not think that house keeping vacuums as the next day, we noticed that they did not vacuum the floors. I had to call front desk and ask them to specifically vaccuum our room. 2) All of us got bed bugs! How did we know? Well we woke up on July 1st night and we had all these spots on our legs (We had one King Size bed and the 3 of us slept on it). THe spots were by our feet/legs and all 3 of us got it. Plus my friend had gotten bed bugs a few yrs ago when she had traveled to Thailand. She has experienced bed bugs and the gross ness associated with it. The guy @ front desk changed our room for us - howver, the "fear" of bed bugs still lingered in our minds. We are back home now (it's July 13),, the bed bug marks are still on my leg but slowly fading away. I had to wash all my clothes and throw away my luggaages as I would be scared if the bed bugs traveled with me back home. AVOID THIS HOTEL IF U DONT WANT BED BUGS!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect 'little' slice”
Reviews.Author: hohagan
Reviews.Content: Looking for a great, QUIET, place to rest your weary feet after running around Manahattan?! This is for you. Quiet, clean, pleasant, and tucked away in the middle of everything. My only hestitancy in telling you about it, is that it could be hard for me to book the next time I go back. Just don't use the concierge, they're outsourced though, so not a true depiction of the quality employees at the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “They made my NYC visit wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GottheShirt
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel early before check-in but they said it was no problem. The front desk lady, Whitney, checked us in with no problems. The lobby was small but I liked that because it felt more personal rather than just another guest. Our room was just like all the pictures I've seen on this site. Yes, it's small but we only planned to sleep there so it was perfect for us. The bathroom was clean and fresh. The bed was also clean (no bed bugs!). We were on the backside of the hotel so it was nice and quiet at night. No street noise. The resturant next door was so yummie and they were beyond nice! A few hours after we checked in, Whitney called our room to make sure that the room was meeting our expectations and to see if we needed anything at all. I've NEVER had the front desk call to make sure I was happy with my room before. I was so plesantly suprised. In the lobby they have a bunch of great useful information about the area including maps and good places to eat. The hotel is 5 minutes from the subway which we loved since that's how we got around the most. I liked not being directly in the middle of "tourist land" because at the end of the day, I just wanted to relax after being a tourist myself. I will be staying here again during my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & good value.”
Reviews.Author: EBM1107
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in June for a quick weekend get-a-way. The hotel is certainly no-frills, with a VERY small lobby and slow-ish elevators. Rooms are typical for NYC - very small, compact and efficient. The hotel staff was pleasant at all times. The location was excellent - only a few blocks from the 1 Train and walking distance to several fun neighborhoods. Only complaint is room temperature - we could not get the temperature to stabilize at a comfortable level. It was either WAY too cold or WAY too hot - and the the AC was on constantly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an affordable, clean, pleasant place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: ishkay
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, the staff was great. The foyer was really small, but decorated very nice.The rooms were smaller than I thought, but the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom is very small, there is just a shower only. In walking distance of lots of places.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappointed!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovestoparty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Chelsea for the 2nd time and had a great stay! The room was ready before check-in and was clean and perfect! The front desk girl named Winnie was the biggest help in anything we all needed. We had a bachelorette party and we had a million questions. I can not wait to come back to NYC and stay here yet again.

Reviews.Title: “A good night sleep”
Reviews.Author: lucy3368
Reviews.Content: The room was smaller then most hotel suites but it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. I slept like a baby. The service was impecable, staff was friendly and knowledgable of the area restaurants.. My friend and I had the best time staying there and visiting the restaurants in the neighborhood..

Reviews.Title: “What's with the housekeeping??”
Reviews.Author: sevgiligirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in April after being transferred from the Wyndham Gardens Times Square South due to no water and a gas leak in the street. Arrived to find very gracious front desk staff but a filthy room. Called the desk at 11pm to have the floor vacuumed. Shower full of mold, dirty washcloth still in the shower, hair too. Daily service sorely lacking, always forgot something, tea or coffee, towels, garbage, even didn't wipe the sinks or mirrors. The concierge was great as were all front desk staff. The Italian place attached to the hotel was very nice, cool atmosphere, great dinner. The Thai place across the street was marvelous. Good location... But OMG they need to get housekeepers who actually do their job! I know what it is, I put myself through school as a housekeeper.

Reviews.Title: “Another Outstanding Stay in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: garbakup
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel in Chelsea/Flatiron District for the fifth or sixth time in the past two years. Had three rooms books for four nights each. All three rooms were very clean. Located us all on the same floor with an early check-in. Had two separate occassions to call the front desk on different nights to ask for help quieting some neighbors on the floor....seemed liked high school field trip participants who were exhuberant to be in NYC and away from their parents for the first time. Problems were resolved within five minutes each time. Tried San Rocco (restaurant adjacent to hotel) for drinks/snacks. Nice and reasonably priced for the city. Aside from a great location and rate, the staff at Wyndham Chelsea are always very professional, polite, and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: aksnorth
Reviews.Content: Despite reserving and paying for a double bedded room, was assigned a king bed room at check-in and had to argue with front desk staff to be placed in the correct room type. Rooms are typical NYC small. Bathroom was very tight, with small shower only, no tub. Linens were fine and beds were nice and comfortable. Carpets in room and hallway could have used a good vacuum. On the 15th floor, and street facing, our room was quiet. I would not have wanted to be on one of the lower floors as the restaurant/bar (San Rocco's) next door had loud action/music spilling out onto the front patio until the wee hours. As noted by earlier reviewers, the lobby of this hotel is absolutely miniscule. Don't plan on spending any time there - or meeting anyone there - as there's just no space. Overall, a decent stay, helped greatly by the super location.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: imeunyoung
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with friends for a girls' night out. We were told about their free WiFi (wish I brought my laptop!) Our room was so cute and dainty. The beds were super comfortable, it felt like I slept on clouds. Our room and bathroom were clean and neat. I had some trouble operating the air conditioning unit at first but within minutes a staff member called to give us a warm welcome and help me with my frustration. The heating and cooling unit was in fact operated by the thermostat on the wall! Front desk staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive. My friends and I were traveling very light so we asked for the nearest drugstore in the area; surprisingly the hotel had extra amenities like toothpaste, toothbrush, shaver, shaving cream, and deodorant. All we had to do was ask for it and they were delivered promptly. Excellent customer service. We had questions about places to eat and nightlife in the area which were all answered knowledgeably. The staff praised the Italian restaurant inside the hotel for happy hour which was an excellent recommendation. Free finger food sampling after purchasing a drink, what a steal! We were here to see the sights and hear the sounds of NYC and the location was perfect for that. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and family. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, sleek design, and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: tomlam
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. The best part is its location with the very handy yellow line right at the corner and Chelsea just blocks away. Strolls over to Gramercy Park, Union Square, Herald Square, or Times Square are all excellent ways are filled with things to look at (and buy!) and an excellent way to see NYC. The design of the building, furniture, and interiors are all very modern and pleasing to the eye. Last but definitely not least, the staff there are happy and friendly people who are full of energy and a desire to help. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ilovevintage
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Friday night while in town for business.Polite attentive staff, fast check in. Beds are insanely comfortable! Convenient to the site I was visiting. I would absolutely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was only good”
Reviews.Author: StrictView
Reviews.Content: Booking: I won a bid on Priceline.com. Give this option a try...if you know how to use the "Negotiator" tool, this could save you money. We got a "King Room", on a higher floor, away from the elevators. Area: This is not the "rich" side of Chelsea...still, it offers good dining options and the subway is nearby. Facilities: The hotel is new, clean...though very small. Room: The room is fine. All the furniture is new, the bed is comfortable, the bathroom (and the toiletries) are nice. Tiny...is an understatement for the overall size of the room(s) though. Good Surprises: All the diners in the area offer good food and quick delivery - they even deliver right to your room door. Strangely Missing: Rooms have everything except for the most important - TOOTHPASTE! Overall: We stayed only for 1 night...it was an average hotel experience...but the price was fair. Tip: Ask front desk for a set of menus from restaurants that deliver...this will save you money & effort. Have fun, be safe, and happy trip!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION BUT NEEDS A GOOD CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: golfwidow53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and overall our stay was great.The location is perfect for exploring new york but the standard of cleaning really leaves much to be desired.The staff are pleasant enough when they are not chatting among themselves and the concierge helpful if you need directions etc but the whole impression this hotel gives is a slovenly unprofessional couldn,t care less one.If they dont raise their standards of housekeeping and customer service i am afraid the hotel will become shabby very quickly(this hotel is only a few years old and already it looks tired)The entrance to the hotel hasn.t been swept for what looks like quite a while and the flooring in the bedrooms is badly in need of the dyson treatment. The beds are really comfortable and the bathrooms ok with good showers ,the rooms are a bit small but you don,t go to New York to stay in the room.Visited the excellent Thai restaurant just across the road and can highly recommend it although there is an italian restaurant adjoining the hotel.Enjoy New York!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Explore NY From.......”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie_06
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located within easy walking distance to the subway, NY attractions, and also NY districts worth exploring. Staff were friendly and helpful during our stay giving us handy directions and recommendations to some great places to eat nearby. Subway is less then 5 min away and less than 10 min walk takes you to the lovely area of Union Square for food and drink. Hotel room was compact, as you would expect in this price range and area. With this being said, the room was well kept, comfortable, modern, and clean. Safe wasn’t bolted down for those that use these regularly. Area was always bustling which made if feel safe when walking back from Times Square area late at night. Plenty eateries, bars, and shops all around the hotel which also comes handy when your legs need a rest from all the exploring. Location of this hotel was the plus point in our opinion making this an ideal place to stay when exploring the sights of NY.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location, friendly staff, nice price: I'd stay again for sure.”
Reviews.Author: midway42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel for four nights with a couple friends while exploring NYC. The location is great: right by the Flatiron Building (which we used as a landmark for the trip) and a 5-10 minute walk from three subway lines. Check-in was efficient and polite. My room was clean, well appointed, and housekeeping clearly does a good job as I had no problems over an extended period of time. There were some minor noise problems as we were right by the elevator but overall these lessened at night and didn't impact the overall stay. The staff was great, we used the concierge a couple times and they were very friendly and helpful, pointing us to several restaurants we wouldn't have found just wandering around. The adjoining restaurant (San Rocco) was also well received, we dined there three times and had a great experience each time; the staff there were also very gracious and accommodating. Overall this was a good experience with a price to match. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel and the location.....”
Reviews.Author: mohicans
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay a single night in this part of Manhattan so we could explore this area a little. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff and were given a clean and comfortable room - small, but this is NY. We had no complaints at all - except for the weather - (pouring rain!) , but the hotel couldn't control that! We walked to the Hotel Chelsea - and to the meatpacking district and to Madison Square Park, (we really enjoyed this park - very under-rated!). In this park you will find the Shake Shack - a New Yorker recommended we try the "scroom" which is a meatless burger and we both agreed that this burger was the Best Burger in the Universe and if we could only do one more think in NYC, it would be to return to the Shake Shack and have a shroom!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy comfort”
Reviews.Author: lbeilin
Reviews.Content: The room is a tight fit, but everything needed is there: wardrobe, very comfortable bed, night table, desk and desk chair; bathroom is shower and sink and toilet. The shower is small and water will go under the curtain. It is more of a problem for me, worrying about the water, than for the condition of the bathroom. Housekeeping missed the previous occupant's muffin crumbs under the desk which could lead to unwanted guests, i.e., mice, roaches. Everything else appeared clean.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but not clean enough.”
Reviews.Author: Blackdays
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndam for 4 nights, and while the staff are friendly and obliging, and the beds are comfortable, the standard of cleanliness is not up to scratch. While my room wasn't filthy by any means, it wasn't clean enough for my liking. When one my my earrings fell off the night stand and onto the floor between the night stand and the bed I was horrified to see how dirty the carpet was, it didn't look like it had been vacuumed for several weeks, it was so dirty that I threw my earring out. The bathroom was cleaned each day, but not thoroughly. On the upside the hotel has free wifi, and is in a good location, only about 15 minutes walk from Madison Square Garden, Times Square, and the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice hotel, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pclMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Prior to arriving I had sent an email to the Assistant Gen. Manager, who had responded to some other posts on this site. I told him that the trip was for my wifes birthday and asked if the hotel offered anything that I could purchase to make the stay more special. He was out of the office for the week so my email was forwarded to the Gen. Manager who upgraded our room to a suite with a balcony. While the room was a little small it was no smaller than any other rooms that we have stayed at in New York City. Upon check in the desk clerk mentioned my wifes birthday and provided us with vouchers for breakfast in the morning. We then went to a great local restaurant that was recommended to us by the Gen. Mgr. and when we returned to the room there was a nice desert with a birthday card from the staff and a balloon in the room. Very nice touch. Another post on this site mentioned noise being a problem but we didn't find that to be the case at all, we had a great nights sleep on both nights. We did stop in the restaurant that is attached to the hotel (Rocco's) for desert on the other night. I'm not sure if this is part of the hotel itself or just shares the same space but we weren't impressed with the restaurant. We were seated at the table for at least a 1/2 hour before our order was taken. We would absolutely stay at this hotel again and have already recommended it to friends. It was a short walk to Chelsea Market, and we also walked to Times Square which was a little far but definitely doable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel; I'll Be Back.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler7117
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of August 2009 for about 7 days w/ my girlfriend. She was happy w/ the hotel & therefore, I was happy w/ the hotel. Her prime criteria for a hotel room is the bathroom & the bed. Thus, the first room she checked out was the bathroom. If the bathroom is not immaculate clean, she would not be a happy camper. If the bed was not comfy, she would not be a happy camper. She was happy w/ both the bathroom & bed. I thought the room (King guestroom) was well organized, functional, & cozy. The selected furniture fitted perfectly in the room in terms of spacing & design. I would not call my room huge, but I would not call it small either. Why? Because this is NYC. Check out the shoeboxes the natives live in & you will know what I mean. I think I can comment w/ some authority having visited another crowded (even more so) metropolis w/ over 12 million people: Tokyo. Staff: Kudos to the cleaning staff for keeping the room, esp. the bathroom, in immaculate shape. The front desk staff was professional & courtesy, even during the crazy busy, hectic times of checking in & checking out. Neighborhood: Located more in Chelsea than the Flatiron, it is conveniently located 1 block away from the F train (23rd St. station) & less than a block away from the N/R train (23rd St. station). Thus from here, you can get uptown or downtown w/ ease. The hotel is 1 block east of Whole Foods on 7th Ave. & about 2 blocks east of Garden of Eden (a NYC high end grocery store). For you foodies, the hotel is also less than a block away from Madison Square Park where Shake Shack is located & a couple of blocks away from Eleven Madison Park Restaurant. The block where the hotel is located is quiet. I like that because when I come home, I like to relax & unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not so impressive service. Terrible air conditioning system and made us feel ill”
Reviews.Author: caz2927
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a week from New Years Eve. On first impressions the hotel looked small, but was in a great location and seemed to have very welcoming staff and nicely furnished heated rooms (it was freezing outside!), comfortable beds and a clean and tidy looking bathroom. However, after the first night, we started noticing major problems. The main one being the air conditioning in our room randomly turning itself on every half an hour through the night and loudly blasting out very cold air for about 30 seconds despite the fact we kept turning the whole thing off. No one sorted this out for us and it was a persistent problem throughout our whole stay. Coming in from the cold we were greeted by blasts of icy air! The heating and the air conditioning were built into one so needless to say it was very cold in the room sometimes, which conidering the temperature outside wasn't pleasant. On about the fifth night the generator for the air conditioning (which was very close to our door in the corridor outside) started humming very loudly and we could hear it through the door. Again, this was another problem no one came to fix. The generator itself was dusty and was creating an odd smell in the corridor. It was obviously linked to the problem we were having in our room. We seemed to feel extremely lethargic and unwell as soon as we got back into the room which made us wonder if there was something wrong with the air being filtered into the hotel. We felt fine at all other times apart from when we were in the room. There was definitely issues with the air quaility. The sheets on the beds seemed too small for the actual bed, which was itself huge and very spacious. The lack of adequate bedding coupled with the icy air being directed at us from the air conditioning didn't really help us have restful nights sleep. The housekeeping was quite poorly done and didn't have a lot of effort put into it. At a quick glance it looked fine - we always had fresh towels and a clean bathroom and the beds looked made. I say looked made as on several occasions we pulled the duvet back to find all the sheets underneath still crumpled up and messy from how we'd slept in them the night before. We also found clothes under the sheets that had oviously just been covered over quickly and tucked under the duvet. On the plus side the hotel was in a nice quiet street and was about a 20 minute walk from Times Square. The Subway on 23rd Street was really useful and the location of the hotel itself coupled with the Subway made everything very accessible. It is very close to the Empire State Building and a good shopping area on 5th Avenue. The hotel reception staff were very pleasant and always greeted us as we went past and on our last day they were happy to look after our cases until we left for the airport. They also provide an airport shuttle service for $20 per person. I'm not sure I'd stay here again. For what we paid, we felt the service could have been must better.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvlr8
Reviews.Content: I had a great rate (under $100 a night), which was a superb value. If I had paid a lot more, I might have been disappointed in the absolutely tiny room. The room did have everything I needed (free internet, extremely comfortable bed, large flat-screen tv, iron and ironing board, etc.). The bathroom was well appointed, but it wasn't spotlessly clean. The hallways are also very small, which means that all of the room doors are relatively close to one another. Doors are opening and closing all day and night, of course, and you can hear conversations in the hallway as if they were in your room. Each morning, the housekeeping staff was camped out on the hallway floor folding towels and sheets, etc., and talking very loudly. In summary, it was a great deal, but the room was small and loud.

Reviews.Title: “Wierd Shower, Pleasant Service”
Reviews.Author: dysphorichousewife
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location - easy access to transportation, good local restaurants. I travel alot and have to say that the employees here are some of the happiest and most helpful that I've encountered. In fact, all of the other guests seemed happy too! Other points about this hotel: Very small lobby, good restaurant/bar on first floor, typical NYC room: small but efficient. My only issue with this hotel was the shower: the shower curtain did not contain the water within the shower stall so the entire bathroom floor got soaked! They really need longer shower curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: blader_mgs
Reviews.Content: The room was on the small side, but this is NYC so what can you expect? It did have a dresser and desk in addition to the bed. Everything was modern and new, plush bedding, all amenities in the bathroom. Flatscreen tv with many channels to choose from. The room and bathroom were very clean. Only problem was the shower curtain was a little too short so water leaked onto the floor. The front desk were very helpful providing maps and directions. Overall, a great experience and I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rob_nyack
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect. Great restaurant right across street, Planet Thailand. Nice bar/Restaurant in adjoining building. Close to all that Chelsea has to offer. Friendly staff , clean rooms. Great nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rhenish
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is petty; the lobby. I know rooms are small (despite everyone's 'spacious' claim; I mean there just isn't room in NYC for that unless you do a really expensive suite somewhere) but I needed 5 more feet of room in the lobby. If there were two guests checking in and one sitting on the couch someone was going to trip. But that's the only complaint. Was able to check in early without paying extra and they allowed us to leave our luggage after check out without charging us. Granted we didn't eat anything in the hotel; those prices were high. But there was a 24 hour deli around the corner (Olympia) that served a mean omlette and darn good bagles. The bed was comfortable and huge. The cable channel was limited, but we weren't there for that. However if my 10 year old would have been with us he would have been disappointed as they did not have a single kids channel. The subways are within easy walking distance. Would easily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice no frills hotel, but where the hell is the bell boy?!”
Reviews.Author: brybread
Reviews.Content: SERVICE: Arrived at the hotel at about 4 in the afternoon on New Year's day. First impression, there was no Bell boy!!! The two of us had to drag 5 luggages, each weighing 46 pounds by ourselves from the taxi up into the hotel pushing the luggage cart by ourselves. (I know its our fault for having so much luggage, but shopping was so good in NY!!!, BUT that's still no excuse for the missing bell boy). Stepping into the small lobby, we were a bit put off by how hectic it was. Lots of people crammed into a really small lobby space with two receptionist multi tasking like crazy was not a good sign. Took about 30 minutes before they could find my reservation. Even had to call up Expedia to double check with them. After that, its another 20 minute wait for our rooms to be available...UMMM isn't the check in time suppposed to be at 3? It's 4.45 now!!! Reason: It's new years day. Wtf. I would've been super pissed if it wasn't for the friendliness of the receptionist. She was so kind to offer snacks and drinks from the little bar fridge in the lobby free of charge. Since there is no Bellboy, we had to push the damn cart into the tiny elevator that takes forever to move. It got to a point that other guests had to help us push the cart into the elevator. Then we had to slowly unload the luggages one by one. Same thing when we were checking out. NO BELL BOY!!! Went downstairs to get the cart, take it up, load my luggages on it, and take it down. Oh and the best bit, reception can't call a taxi to the hotel. I had to go get one myself!!! As the hotel is located on a quiet street, I had to run down to an avenue, cross the road, and actually hail a taxi to drive to the hotel. I have never heard of this and find it utterly ridiculous! I guess this is what you get for paying for a 2* accommodation. ROOMS: Okay. Small, but its NY. Bed occupied most of the room, but it was heaven. It's a Seally Posturepedic. and that is what I'm going to get back home! Bath room had an awkwardly placed shower, but it was alright. Water pressure was pretty crabby though. Not strong enough for my liking. LOCATION: It had a lovely neighbourhood in Chelsea and is like two minutes walk to the Flatiron building. Apart from a few lil mishaps, I did enjoy my stay at the Wyndham and would stay there once again when I'm back in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vogeljam
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here for the weekend. I frequent NYC from California usually 4 times a year and have stayed at a couple of other hotels that were nice but noting compared to Wyndham Garden. Upon arival I was greeted by a friendly and warm staff. We talked, exchanged conversation and it was very warm, not stale. I chose not to get room cleaning service and housekeeping was gracious enough to bring towels when I called, again very conversationalist. My room was very comfortable. Had a nice work area, nice coffee maker and very comfortable bed. My room had a balcony although it was very cold (remember California boy here) so I did not partake in that feature this stay. Many food outlets in walking distance and also many shops and such.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but a little cramped (and don't plan on having access to the elevator much)!”
Reviews.Author: BillieTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 3 other people in a room on the 10th floor with 2 double beds. The space was cramped---but for the money it wasn't something to complain about in NYC. The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly, but the elevators are CONSTANTLY being occupied by laundry/housekeeping. Twice we ended up waiting 15 mins for the elevator, and ended up climbing the stairs. We didn't mind, but if you have a problem with climbing stairs, request a room on one of the lower floors. While this was a setback---elevator takes FOREVER to come---it wouldn't prevent me from staying here again. It was a great value, and clean. But, if you're a business traveler, and are on a tight time schedule, I'd avoid staying here.

Reviews.Title: “There were pubes on the pillows...Bring your own pillow!”
Reviews.Author: carolyn9231
Reviews.Content: -Overall, we think the hotel wasn't toooooo bad, but the bedding was gross. there were hairs in the bed, and brown marks on the pillows.. and I don't think you would want to sleep on that. -The breakfast was okay, but the server got my toast stuck in the toaster, and he still gave it to me after, even though it was burnt. -Small bedrooms, not a lot of room for luggage, but very modern -There were no counters in the bathroom, only enough room for a toothbrush. -My friend left her washcloth in the bathroom during the day and the cleaning lady took it with the laundry, and she didn't get it back. -Some guy came to our door to tell us to be quiet and we weren't even being loud. -Don't sleep by the window, you will freeze your butt off, and you won't sleep a wink, because it was so loud outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Great Neighborhood for Unpretentious Travelers”
Reviews.Author: celusnek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wyndham Garden Inn Chelsea seven nights, from December 23 to December 30, 2009. Most all hotels in Manhattan considered the last few nights of our stay as part of the high priced New Years Eve week. We were getting decent rates for the first 3 or 4 nights, but the last few nights tripled! We ended up calling hotels directly to ask for a lower price for those nights since we would be staying so long. Wyndham Garden Inn Chelsea was the only hotel that would adjust their prices. So we paid $149 for the first six nights and $229 for the last night, before taxes of about $20 a night. We paid about $40 for a taxi from LGA. The hotel is on 24th Street halfway between 5th and 6th Streets (a little closer to 6th), just one block over from the major cross-street in Chelsea, 23rd Street. There are subway stations all along 23rd street. The closest to the hotel is the FV station at 6th Avenue, but the 1, RW, 6 and CE stations aren’t far within ¼ mile. The location of the hotel is its best feature. There is quick access to all parts of the city. But Chelsea/Flat Iron is full of interesting shops and incredible restaurants. We walked to all of these restaurants… we had breakfast at Murray’s Bagel (on 8th Avenue south of 23rd Street), had the best BBQ brisket ever at RUB (on 23rd Street between 7th and 8th Avenue), had an excellent European brunch at Markt, enjoyed incredible soup at Pipa’s inside the ABC Carpet Shop on Broadway, indulged in old fashioned diner-style meals at the Lyric Diner on 3rd Avenue, and even sipped shakes at Burger Shack in the Madison Square Park. The area has really fun for people watching. The hotel is obviously newly re-constructed. All the materials and fixtures are new. There is essentially no lobby. The doors open right at the front desk. There is a sofa and a couple ottomans but it’s not a spot you would spend time. A ticket desk/concierge is squeezed into a corner. The restaurant is supposed to be a part of the hotel, but it didn’t really seem that way. We never ate there. Room 903 is steps from the elevator and faces the front of the building. The small room was adequate for two people who travel well together but don’t think of sharing a room with someone who get’s on your nerves. It has a desk and chair, big flat screen TV on the wall, arm chair, two nightstands, a luggage rack and a closet equipped with an iron/board. There is no dresser. The king sized bed has a good quality mattress topped with a comfy feather bed. The sheets are good quality (probably 350-threadcount). The duvet and comforter are nice and cozy. The pillows are decent foam. The heating system was a little quirky; it made a lot of noise whenever it kicked on. But we got used to it and slept through the repeated ruckus. The bathroom is well equipped with a good-sized shower, decent towels, enough counter space and True Blue Spa soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion. The water pressure and temperature were good. Except one morning there was no hot water. By the time we went down to the lobby, the repair truck was already parked in front of the hotel and they were repairing the frozen boiler. We had plenty of hot water when we returned that afternoon. Our room was cleaned completely and promptly when we’d leave in the morning. Although no one knocked when we had the do not disturb sign on the door, the cleaning crew was very noisy. Two of them even got into a screaming match about who wasn’t working fast enough! But everyone on the staff was very friendly to the guests. The hotel worked for us because we don’t need a fancy lobby, an onsite restaurant or other services. It was a good value for the price compared to other hotels in Manhattan. It is in an area that we like and has good access to public transportation. If you travel like we do, you’ll like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small cozy hotel in West Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: mumbai_da_munda
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is excellent and so is the concieragee.Got some valuable tips from the concierage that helped us in our sightseeing. But the hotel by itself is very small. Extremely small lobby, no business center, fitness room is a joke and the rooms are small as well. Nothing anyone can do about it but works out well as long as you are aware of this fact. THe fitness room s on the lower level and the room had a dirty musky smell 2 it. It had 1 treadmill and 2 ellipticals very close to each other. THey have complimentary internet wireless but alas hadn't taken my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Outstanding but wasn't terrible”
Reviews.Author: tlc1986
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and in a great location. Rooms were small but comfortable and free wireless was a great benefit. Our first room was extremely loud and the staff were more than happy to move us to a much quieter room which was much appreciated. House cleaning however was very loud in the morning and failed to remove unwanted rubbish from our room. As there were no printers, so when we asked a staff member to print some tickets for us she was rather rude about it. I don't know why as she was standing there doing nothing anyway. Overall the stay was ok. As my title says, it wasn't outstanding, but it wasn't terrible.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rickpw
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but serviceable and clean. Bed was good. Bathroom was nicely decorated, good shower. I wouldn't really call this in Chelsea, which is a few blocks west and south.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to subway, great stay overall!”
Reviews.Author: annieb37
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel partly due to the good reviews it had and I can say I wasn't disappointed! The ladies on reception were both very friendly and helpful and made me feel very welcome. I had a King Size bed and my room was fairly small but very clean. Bed was super comfortable although the pillows were a little high for me (I like them to 'squish' right down when laying on them!). The bathroom was lovely, unusual to find I didn't have a bathtub though, just the shower. Very clean and although I put up my towels to reuse the following day they gave me new ones. The coffee maker didn't work so I asked them to have a look which didn't happen but to be honest I wasn't bothered really. I didn't use the shampoo and conditioner as always use my own but the body lotion they supplied was lovely! Location wise was fab. Just 1 block to the F/V trains. I walked to Macy's which is only 10 blocks away (fairly small blocks) and then you have Union Square (14th St) in the opposite direction. There wasn't really anything negative except for I had to wait quite a while to collect my luggage as the guy had popped out and the receptionists were too busy to get it from me. All in all a great hotel in an excellent location and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Small but Quiet and Cozy Room, Good Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: gcowden
Reviews.Content: The room was small but quiet and the bed comfortable. But really, do you travel to New York to spend your time in the hotel? I found the staff to be not only friendly but competent and helpful. Anything that I needed was promply available upon request. The location was convenient to both bus and subway lines. The San Rocco Restaurant and Bar staff were very friendly. Although I did not have dinner there, I did enjoy the small but quite good happy hour aperitivo selection.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: rbreig
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, very comfortable bed, very fresh and clean, very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Pit stop for busy manhattan travellers”
Reviews.Author: conary
Reviews.Content: If you need a spacious room, an impressive lobby with a cozy fireplace and upscale dining, consider the Waldorf=Astoria. It will cost you, though. For those of you who prefer to spend as much time as possible in the city instead of in their hotel room, but want an centrally located hotel with a comfy bed, their own bathroom (by far not standard for NYC) and free internet access, this could just be the ticket. The rooms are small, no question. But the bathrooms are regular sized and stacked with a good selection of toiletries. The room I was in had a king bed, a small desk and a closet. That was it. It was clean and the furniture seemed really new. The bed was very comfortable. Sometimes I would hear housekeeping staff outside of my door in the mornings, but otherwise the hotel was pretty quiet. The location, 24th and 7th Ave, is right in the middle of manhattan - you can get anywhere pretty quickly from here. There are two subway stations rigtht one block down the road and a couple over on 23rd street. There is also a fitness center in the hotel, which I haven't used, though.

Reviews.Title: “Theater ... mania”
Reviews.Author: WVMorningGlory
Reviews.Content: In one week I saw two Broadway shows, three off-Broadway shows, one production in the Fringe Encore Series, two independent films, a reading for a new play and attended Fashion Week showing for `A La Disposition. What an incredible, unforgettable week it was! While New York itself is theatre at its finest, there is an endless array of wonderful performances. "Wicked" is a spectacle - beautifully done. Both female leads are superb. "Next to Normal", also produced by David Stone, was amazing. The Atlantic Theater Company's production of "Oohrah!" was powerful and thought-provoking. Keep your eye on this new playwright, Bekah Brunstetter - she is brilliant. Obviously, since my daughter was in this production, I am (a bit) biased. Great ensemble cast. This was my first stay at Wyndham Gardens in the Chelsea district and it was really lovely. Very quiet and the staff was wonderful. Kudos to Travelocity for the arrangements - everything was smoothly done. Wonderful trip. Thank you New York, until my next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, fine but small rooms - but the WORST SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: brisbanesbest
Reviews.Content: We got this place at a good price for just a couple of days at the end of our trip. We knew the rooms would be small so were prepared for that - and they were, but it was bearable. What wasn't bearable, however, was the simply atrocious service from the front of house staff. The concierge was useless and we were routinely hung up on when we rang from our room with inquiries. One of us became quite ill and we called asking for a list of local doctors and she said the hotel had no medical staff and she couldn't help. It was ridiculous. Front of house staff equally useless and also hung up on us a couple of times. We weren't asking more much - just basic things like an extra blanket and some printing. It is a shame the service is so appalling because the location and the price is great. If you do stay there, you must visit the Shake Shack at madison square park. Oh, they have free internet too which is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but fairly priced.”
Reviews.Author: mello_yello_jen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and it was a cute hotel. The rooms were on the smaller size and this hotel overall is not too big but for the price we paid, I don't have too many complains. Customer service is pretty good but the first night we were there, the bed wasn't made and when we got back to the hotel room that night, our key wasn't working. Little mishaps here-and-there but they were resolved promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service.”
Reviews.Author: lake09
Reviews.Content: Just got off the phone to make reservations..the guy I spoke with was incredibly rude. I changed my mind on the spot and didn't make the reservations. Now off to find another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value, Cool Boutique Type Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrfoxycat
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this Hotel is you are interested in Location and Good Value for your Money. The Location for this Hotel is Great -Very close to Union Square, the Flatiron Building, Empire State Building, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Chelsea and other landmarks. All within easy walking distance. It is also very convenient to many subway lines. The building is brand new and it is on a quiet street just one block beyond 23rd St. The building was nice, the room was good - not huge but it met our needs for a few days stay. We Got a Great Room Rate which was good for a Stay in New York. Most New York Hotels are too expensive and not worth the price, but this one was Great. For the same price, I would happily stay at this hotel again. The location, cleanliness, and price cant be beat. I am very glad that we stayed here as opposed to somewhere else. It met our Needs Very Well. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived later than usual and they checked us in quickly and had our room ready. They even offered us a discount rate for an extra nite or two for the room because we may have had to stay longer due to a heavy snowstorm that was about to hit the New York Metro area that day but we were able to leave before it arrived. That was really nice to offer that to us. Quality: I was impressed when we first entered the room. The hallway was warm, but the room was perfectly heated and comfortable as it was brutally cold outside. The room was very clean and cozy. Granted, it was a small but you have to expect that in Manhattan. We had no problems with it. I would highly recommend this hotel for location, value and its cool boutique style. Well worth it. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good standard of room”
Reviews.Author: Holsoholic
Reviews.Content: Close to the subway (at end of the block) & central to New Yorks main attractions. The Flat Iron building is just at the end of the block & it's an easy walk to Times square, Empire State or Macy's, we even walked to Wall Street & Central Park. Room was clean with tea & coffee facilities & air con, bed very comfy. Bathroom (shower only) was of high standard. Staff friendly, & to easy check in/out, even though hotel was fully booked during our visit. There was a concierge, but we did not find her very useful, we did see she had a colleague who may be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lawbabe113
Reviews.Content: Location: within walking distance of Times Square and Rockefeller Center. A vareity of subway stations nearby. We took the subway to the Statue of Liberty and then took our time walking back to the hotel and checking out the downtown neighborhoods of Soho, Tribeca, the Village, Chinatown, etc. Lots of great restaurants and bar in the area. Staff: very friendly and helpful. I'm very surprised at the reviews claiming the staff was unhelpful. We arrived early and they checked us in and had a room ready. They answered questions about the area, how to get around, and good places to eat. Quality: I was impressed when we first entered the room. The hallway was warm, but the room was perfectly air conditioned. The room was very clean and comfortable. Yes, it's a bit small - that's what you get in Manhattan. But my boyfriend and I had enough room for the two of us and our bags. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool boutique type hotel”
Reviews.Author: bogwoppit
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel as part of a travelocity package, great rate. We arrived at 9am and were greeted in a friendly manner. They offered to take our bags for the day whilst. Back to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing, we were checked in quickly. The room was a two double room. Planty big enough for our needs. Room for our suitcases, one at the end of the bed on the satnd and one on the desk at the end of the other bed. Wardrobe held all our clothes. There was no real place in the bathroom for our toliet bags. There were tons of nice towels and the shower was great, nice pressure and good pressure. We found the bathroom did smell mildewy, but with the door closed it was fine. Products, coffee and tolietries were not replenished daily, but it didn't really bother us. We are not picky travellers. The beds were very comfortable, the tv was great. Room was at the front of the hotel and we didn't suffer from too much street noise. A few inconsiderate British guests retuning at 1am was the only bugbear, but that is hardly the hotels issue. We only encountered helpful staff. The room was kept very clean and tidy. Hallways were neat but warm. Two elevators were fine and we know the hotel was full for two of our 3 nights. THe location was perfect, we could walk everywhere and enjoyed being away from the traditional tourist areas. Good food close by, Wholefoods store and Starbucks within a very short walk. HIgh speed in ternet was free and the best I have ever used in a hotel. Fast and furious! I would definitely saty here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quaint, Affordable and a Great Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: RJDTravels
Reviews.Content: I was only in New York City for one night to celebrate a birthday with some friends and found this hotel through a great deal on a discount hotel website (I am all about the discounts and moderately priced hotels). While the lobby is incredibly small and the elevators can be slow, the room was decently sized and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was amply stocked with some nice amenities and the towels were very plush. The closet space is incredibly SMALL. I was only there for one night so this was not an issue for me. I would not recommend staying more than a weekend here. It seems best for short stays. The staff were SUPER friendly and called my room 30 minutes after I checked in to see if everything was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and small”
Reviews.Author: JaysonV
Reviews.Content: The room was small but ok. NIce location. Quiet. Close to many spot of interes

Reviews.Title: “Great location but....”
Reviews.Author: dvs101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, very close to Union Square, Madison Square Park, Chelsea and other landmarks. It is also very convenient to many subway lines. The building is brand new and sits on the site of a former parking lot, it's set on a quite street just behind the busy 23rd St. The building was pretty nice, the room was also decent - not huge but well set up given its size. The only real problem we had was with housekeeping service. The day we checked in the bathroom didn't look very clean and there were LOTS of hairs (head AND otherwise) all over the floor. Then they somehow "forgot" to clean our room the next day even though we were out for at least 8 hours. They did try to send somebody up to clean when I called the front desk, but who wants a cleaning person in your room when you are getting ready to go out? Also, we had an issue w/ the electronic keys that wouldn't open the door on the second night, which was a real pain to deal w/ when we came back from being out at 3 am. All in all, it was a decent place for the price, I would probably give them another chance - but I hope they deal w/ the housekeeping issue that seems to be the sticking point w/ most of the reviews (how hard is it to get a decent cleaning staff in NYC?)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toltecs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Garden in mid-June at a really great rate for NYC. The location is the best attribute of this hotel. Union Square, the Flatiron building, the Empire State building, Little India, and Penn Station are all withing reasonable walking distance. There are two subway stations on different lines within a block of the hotel. Plenty of options for meals, drinks, shopping, etc. Overall, Chelsea is very nice and much less touristy than Midtown. The hotel was just ok due to a few problems during our stay. We were given a clean room on the 6th floor on the back with the view of an airshaft. Free Wi-Fi was nice, but a little slow. The room was pretty small, but NYC generally has small rooms. We had a wardrobe for hanging clothes with an iron, ironing board inside and small coffee maker/set. One of the problems we had was a lack of any places to set anything down in the room (other than the floor). In the entire room, we only had one small nightstand. As a result, you have to try and sqeeze your wallet, keys, guidebook, map, subway card, drink, watch, remote control, clock, etc. on that one nightstand. I am not sure where you are supposed to actually MAKE the coffee. We tried making ours on the top of the toilet tank and on the floor. No closet. No desk or safe in the room although they are listed as amenities on the website. They did deliver a safe to go in our wardrobe when we requested it. I had to go to the front desk to get more shampoo and conditioner because they didn't give us anymore when they cleaned the room. The bed was the highpoint of the room itself. It was a large, King bed with nice linens and pillows. During our stay, they were in the process of renovating the restaurant downstairs. As a result, we listened to hammers and banging if we were in the room during the day. As others have said, the shower design is terrible. It is impossible to shower and not get most of the bathroom floor wet. As referenced by a previous reviewer, the first morning we woke up at the Wyndham Garden there was no hot water. The staff apologized and suggested that it might be repaired soon, but we waited for a while and, in the end, took cold showers. For the same price, I would probably stay at this hotel again and hope that the stay would be better. The location, cleanliness, and price is what would bring me back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A1shopper
Reviews.Content: This is our first time staying here and it lived up to our expectations. It is in a great location a quick walk to Penn Station. The rooms are nicely decorated and yes on the small side like almost all NYC rooms. The lobby is hot as are the halls. The high speed internet works great. The only improvement needed is housekeeping. I have been here for days and the bathroom floor has not been cleaned. Same coffee spill on floor each day, no toilet paper refilled. Called down to desk twice and one hour later still no toilet paper had to actually go down to desk to get this much needed product. Glasses in room have not been replaced either and I have washed them myself each day. I think they make the bed, wipe down the bathroom and refill coffee products. Besides the housekeeping issue we have loved this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First "oh no!", then "oh yes!"”
Reviews.Author: call_me_a_cab
Reviews.Content: I arrived before lunch on what turned out to be the most humid day in the history of New York. The small Wyndham lobby was filled to the brim with a group checking out and waiting for a cab, and somebody else was asking the front desk "will the hot water be back on by tomorrow?" "Oh no", I thought. Front desk was extremely polite and helpful, and assured me that, although my room would not be available till 3:00 p.m., the hot water would indeed be back on by that time. They also said my room would be nicely air-conditioned, even if the lobby was not. They held my suitcase, checked me in, and said "we'll see you around 3:00." Off I went, a little worried, for an actively sweaty day in the city. When I returned around 3:30, one of the bellman looked at me, looked up at the sky, and said "is it raining?" No, it was just soooo humid out, I was drenched. I got my key, and he pressed the button for my floor (16) and he said he'd return with my suitcase in 5 minutes. "Oh yes", I said, as I entered my refreshingly coooooool room, with a balcony. Everything was crisp and clean. Beautifully appointed king bed, nice comfy chair, long desk and comfortable desk chair. Decent-sized bathroom, with many many thick & plush towels and fantastic bath products. Five minutes later my suitcase arrived, and I hopped in the shower. Yes, there was plenty of hot water, although truth be told, I would have taken a cold shower at that point due to the heat and humidity outside. Speaking of outside, balcony was nice. Not a lot of privacy (if neighbor been out there as well, we would have had to introduce ourselves), but enough space to hang out and have a drink and soak in the city sky. I met friends for dinner, and we all decided to come back to my hotel room for a glass of wine. Although the restaurant was unable to accommodate wine glasses for 7 of us (no restaurant or bar), we had our own plasticware, so there was no problem. But the point is, there were SEVEN of us in the room and on the balcony, and there was PLENTY of room. We could have had a few more, no problem. This hotel is also quiet, since there is no restaurant or bar, and that is a major plus for me. I hate "hot spot" hotels that have ka-BOOM music playing all night, and you attempt to get into your room as thousands of bridge & tunnel commuters vie for a position in line. No thanks. This place gets an "A". We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Micheal84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel in Chelsea for one week and we were delighted with the hotel. Firstly, the location is wonderful. The hotel is located just off Madison Square Park on West 24th Street. It's nice and quiet but a short walk from attractions such as Chelsea, Times Square, the Empire State Building. There is also a Subway station adjacent to the hotel which helps greatly getting around Manhattan. The front desk staff, housecleaning and security staff we met were all very friendly and helpful. Our room was located on the 17th floor and had a really comfortable king size mattress. The room itself was tastefully decorated in a modern style with a nice large flatscreen TV, writing desk, air/con and a good sized bathroom. The room was on the smaller side but this is typical for Manhattan. The rate we got was extremely good for such a comfortable and well located hotel in New York city. There is a small fitness room that we didn't get around to using! The free Wi-fi was fast and reliable. Dining facilites at the hotel are limited, but in a city with as many food options as New York this did not bother us! For those who want to eat at the hotel, I think the breakfast bar serving Starbucks and pastries at the front desk is the only option, but trust me there are lovely delis and diners to try minutes from the hotel. Delighted with our stay in the Wyndham Garden and will certainly consider again when back in New York. Luxurious comfort at a bargain price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: timdoody
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights at start of June. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable and clean with good facilities. Hotel is located very close to two subway stations and for those who prefer to walk it is about 20mins from Times Square and an ideal location for exploring Chelsea and Greenwich!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: parker362
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Garden Chelsea for 5 days in May and thought the location was great. Very close to the subway line, Flatiron building and Madison Square Park. The room we stayed in was small but we only used it to sleep! So much to do in NY! A few comments for management would be: The bathroom could have been a bit cleaner, not sure the floor was cleaned before we checked in. When we asked the front desk about help with getting tickets to a Broadway show we were just told to "check the internet" A little more help, tips or ideas would have been nice. Lastly, a street/subway map of Manhattan would have been great. Most hotels give these out but the front desk only seemed to have a map of the Flatiron district. Over all a great stay here and would definitely recommend it to others as well as stay here again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you get a good price-I Did”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanKelly
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a little tight, but have all the basic nessecities. Comfy bed, friendly & helpful staff. Location close to Flatiron, subway, and good bagel shop. Who comes to New York and spends that much time in the room? If you are not wanting to use the subway or cabs very much, then pay more and stay more centrally located. Otherwise, good base location for exploring the city. Includes free Wi-Fi, very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kag5
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Garden is in a very convenient, quiet loction on a side road. The rooms are small but perfectly formed and are very clean. Only gripe was that only one lift was working for the duration of our stay (6 days) which was annoying and the desk staff didn't appaer to care. Overall a good, clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So close to 5 stars...”
Reviews.Author: nodata
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Wyndham Garden. It scored high on so many things - friendly staff (everyone!), comfy beds, very posh bedding and towels, extra towels and pillows, nice toiletries, lots of restaurants, convenient to walk to just about everywhere, loads of plusses! Our king room was big enough - fit a desk and chair and comfy chair without a problem. And we didn't need to move anything to walk around the bed. Unfortunately, they got dragged down by cleanliness. We had to ask for our room to be vacuumed ... from the previous tenant. And I'm sure it was not vacuumed daily. It really was close to perfect, but lack of good cleaning staff/policies really drags it down. I am clinging to the idea that these are teething pains, because I loved so much about it. We would probably stay again, because the front desk staff really helped get things cleaned up. I would just love if the management would back them up with a "clean daily" policy.

Reviews.Title: “Man, when they say small, they mean small!”
Reviews.Author: babynrz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, and located well. But for 2 people, if we had to stay in the hotel room our entire stay we would have gone mad! Perfect for sleeping- and that's it.( The sheets were really really soft, and the mattress was quite comfy). I had to close our window curtains because I felt like I was going to fall out of the room.The bathroom was quite large, and it did have a nice flat screen tv. The employees were very friendly and helpful. Undecided if I'd stay here again. The price was good though, just so small.

Reviews.Title: “One word can sum my experience up - AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: jintonic01
Reviews.Content: When I stumbled in awkwardly with quite a few shopping bags, I was immediately greeted by the assistant general manager, Carlton. He was very friendly, professional in manners, and helpful (he even offered to bring my bags up for me). I didn't have reservations because it was a last minute overnight stay in the city. He set me up with a nice king size bed - in a quiet corner room. The bathroom was clean (stocked with bath and body products - one of my favorite brands), bed was extremely plush and comfortable, temperature was perfect (didn't need to adjust at all) and a 32 inch flat panel HD TV kept me entertained. I slept like a baby and checkout went smoothly in the morning. Before leaving, I had asked his staff for suggestions on great eats around the area (supplied me with quite a few options). This hotel even had a Starbucks, literally, a few feet from the elevators (perfect for my morning coffee addiction)!! Rates was reasonable for this stay, especially for a king size bed!

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel, in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rmrvf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wyndham Garden Hotel (Manhattan Chelsea West), which I booked through the internet. The hotel was really well located, in the middle of Chelsea, with all its art galleries and near to the subway. The room was large, nicely furnished, and always very clean. We were on the 7th floor and heard no street noise whatsoever. Breakfast was not included, but there was a cafeteria on the ground floor, serving Starbucks coffees, where we could have a good breakfast for a very reasonable price. It was open all day. One of the waitresses, Kathy, was very friendly and helpful and deserves a word of gratitude here. There are some nice details, like free wireless (which we didn´t use) and a newspaper at the door every morning. Of the reception staff I point out Winnie, for being so nice, efficient, having very good suggestions and making us feel really welcome. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Would definitily stay again!”
Reviews.Author: DaniML
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with a perfect location when visiting NYC! We stayed for 8 nights and were very impressed! The hotel was very clean and room service came every day to clean/make beds/bring fresh towels. Was not impressed with the fitness room, but we weren't there to work out anyway. The room itself was on the smaller side, but that's expected in NYC. It was actually a decent size for NYC standards. The staff was also very nice for the most part. A couple of the people working there had an "I don't care" kind of attitude. Not rude, but not going out of their way to help either. Everyone else was very nice and helpful. The little cafe that's part of the hotel has a small selection of foods and a big selection of drinks/coffee. This hotel was the perfect base for everything Manhattan (right by the Flatiron Bldg). There is a Subway station just around the corner in either direction. Times Square is maybe 15 min by foot and about 7 min with Subway. We never felt worried or scared to walk around the area even late at night. We would absolutely stay here again!!
